2236 

2237@log_qa 

2238def score_decoherence_assessment(ms: MeasurementSet, phaserms_results, outlier_antennas: str): 

2239 """ 

2240 Assess the cycle time phase RMS value, which is important as everything longer than a cycle time 

2241 is corrected by phase referencing (in terms of atmospheric phase variations). 

2242 

2243 Also checks the outlier antennas and the 80th percentile baseline with and without flagged antennas. 

2244 """ 

2245 try: 

2246 phasermscycle_p80: float = phaserms_results['phasermscycleP80'] 

2247 bl_p80: float = phaserms_results['blP80'] 

2248 bl_p80_orig: float = phaserms_results['blP80orig'] 

2249 

2250 initial_score = 1.0 - phasermscycle_p80/100.0 

2251 RMSstring = str(round(phasermscycle_p80, 2)) 

2252 

2253 LOG.info("For {0}, the Phase RMS calculated over the cycle time for the unflagged baselines longer than 80th percentile is {1} \ 

2254 deg".format(ms.basename, RMSstring)) 

2255 

2256 # Stable Phases, < 30 deg phaseRMS 

2257 if initial_score > 0.7: 

2258 base_score = 1.0 

2259 shortmsg = "Excellent stability Phase RMS (<30deg)." 

2260 longmsg = "For {0}, excellent stability: The baseline-based median phase RMS for baselines longer than P80 is {1} \ 

2261 deg over the cycle time.".format(ms.basename, RMSstring) 

2262 

2263 # Check for problem antennas and update the score if needed. 

2264 # these are outliers >100 deg, or those beyond "outlier_limit" in SSFherusitics (6 MAD) 

2265 if len(outlier_antennas) > 0: 

2266 base_score = 0.9 

2267 

2268 elif initial_score > 0.5 and initial_score <= 0.7: 

2269 # 30 to 50 deg phase RMS: not really a problem just informative 

2270 # that the phase noise is elevated - no 'need' to look 

2271 # as 50 deg phase RMS can still cause ~30% decoherence 

2272 base_score = 0.9 

2273 shortmsg = "Stable conditions phase RMS (30-50deg)." 

2274 longmsg = "For {0}, good stability: The baseline-based median phase RMS for baselines longer than P80 is {1} \ 

2275 deg over the cycle time.".format(ms.basename, RMSstring) 

2276 

2277 # These are high phase noise - 

2278 # outliers have already been clipped past 100 degrees 

2279 # and those >4 MAD above the P80 phase RMS value 

2280 # so, if we still get here, the phases were poor/v.bad - or there 

2281 # were too many antennas classed as bad in the analysis function 

2282 elif initial_score <= 0.5 and initial_score > 0.3: 

2283 # 50 - 70 deg phase RMS, i.e. 30-50% lost due to decoherence 

2284 # The initial score is representative 

2285 base_score = initial_score 

2286 shortmsg = "Elevated Phase RMS (50-70deg) exceeds stable parameters." 

2287 longmsg = "For {0}, elevated phase instability: The baseline-based median phase RMS for baselines longer than P80 is {1} \ 

2288 deg over the cycle time. Some image artifacts/defects may occur.".format(ms.basename, RMSstring) 

2289 

2290 elif initial_score <= 0.3: 

2291 if initial_score <= 0.0: 

2292 base_score = 0.0 

2293 else: 

2294 base_score = initial_score 

2295 

2296 shortmsg = "High Phase RMS (>70deg) exceeds limit for poor stability" 

2297 longmsg = "For {0}, very poor phase stability: The baseline-based median phase RMS for baselines longer than P80 is {1} \ 

2298 deg over the cycle time. Significant image artifacts/defects may be present.".format(ms.basename, RMSstring) 

2299 

2300 else: # This should never happen 

2301 base_score = 0.0 

2302 shortmsg = "The phase RMS could not be assessed." 

2303 longmsg = "For {}, the spatial structure function could not be assessed".format(ms) 

2304 

2305 # Append antenna outlier information to longmsg if present 

2306 if len(outlier_antennas) > 0: 

2307 if len(outlier_antennas.split(",")) == 1: 

2308 longmsg = "{0} {1} has higher phase RMS.".format(longmsg, outlier_antennas) 

2309 else: 

2310 longmsg = "{0} {1} have higher phase RMS".format(longmsg, outlier_antennas) 

2311 

2312 # The P80 is shorter than the P80 of all data due to notable baseline flagging 

2313 # tbd but if the P80 is 10-15% lower than expected - i.e. can later impact QA2 

2314 # as the longer baselines have maybe been flagged out 

2315 if bl_p80 < bl_p80_orig * 0.85: 

2316 LOG.info("P80 of unflagged data is more than 15% shorter than P80 of all baselines due to baseline and antennas flags") 

2317 if base_score == 1.0: 

2318 base_score = 0.9 

2319 longmsg = "{} P80 of unflagged data is more than 15% shorter than P80 of all baselines".format(longmsg) 

2320 

2321 except: 

2322 # For any error in the above: 

2323 base_score = 0.0 

2324 phasermscycle_p80 = 0.0 

2325 shortmsg = "The phase RMS could not be assessed." 

2326 longmsg = "For {}, the spatial structure function could not be assessed.".format(ms.basename) 

2327 LOG.error(traceback.format_exc()) 

2328 

2329 # Create metric origin 

2330 phase_stability_origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='Phase stability', 

2331 metric_score=phasermscycle_p80, 

2332 metric_units='Degrees') 

2333 

2334 return pqa.QAScore(base_score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, vis=ms.basename, origin=phase_stability_origin, 

2335 weblog_location=pqa.WebLogLocation.ACCORDION) 

2336

2338@log_qa 

2339def score_missing_phaseup_snrs(ms, spwids, phsolints): 

2340 """ 

2341 Score is the fraction of spws with phaseup SNR estimates 

2342 """ 

2343 # Compute the number of expected and missing SNR measurements 

2344 nexpected = len(spwids) 

2345 missing_spws = [] 

2346 for i in range(len(spwids)): 

2347 if not phsolints[i]: 

2348 missing_spws.append(spwids[i]) 

2349 nmissing = len(missing_spws) 

2350 

2351 if nexpected <= 0: 

2352 score = 0.0 

2353 longmsg = 'No phaseup SNR estimates for %s ' % ms.basename 

2354 shortmsg = 'No phaseup SNR estimates' 

2355 elif nmissing <= 0: 

2356 score = 1.0 

2357 longmsg = 'No missing phaseup SNR estimates for %s ' % ms.basename 

2358 shortmsg = 'No missing phaseup SNR estimates' 

2359 else: 

2360 score = float(nexpected - nmissing) / nexpected 

2361 longmsg = 'Missing phaseup SNR estimates for spws %s in %s ' % \ 

2362 (missing_spws, ms.basename) 

2363 shortmsg = 'Missing phaseup SNR estimates' 

2364 

2365 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_missing_phaseup_snrs', 

2366 metric_score=nmissing, 

2367 metric_units='Number of spws with missing SNR measurements') 

2368 

2369 applies_to = pqa.TargetDataSelection(vis={ms.basename}, spw={spwid for spwid in spwids}) 

2370 

2371 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, vis=ms.basename, origin=origin, applies_to=applies_to)

2552 

2553@log_qa 

2554def score_derived_fluxes_snr(ms, measurements): 

2555 """ 

2556 Score the SNR of the derived flux measurements. 

2557 

2558 See PIPE-644 for latest description. 

2559 

2560 Linearly scale QA score based on SNR value, where 

2561 QA = 1.0 if SNR >= 26.25 

2562 QA = 0.66 if SNR < 5.0 

2563 and QA linearly scales from 0.66 to 1.0 between SNR 5 to 26.25. 

2564 

2565 These QA and SNR threshold were chosen such that SNR values in the range of 

2566 5-20 should map to QA scores in the range that will show as a blue 

2567 "suboptimal" level QA message. 

2568 """ 

2569 # Loop over measurements 

2570 nmeasured = 0 

2571 score = 0.0 

2572 minscore = 1.0 

2573 minsnr = None 

2574 snr_thresh = 26.25 

2575 low_snr_flux = collections.defaultdict(list) 

2576 

2577 for fieldid, field_measurements in measurements.items(): 

2578 # Loop over the flux measurements 

2579 for measurement in field_measurements: 

2580 fluxjy = measurement.I.to_units(measures.FluxDensityUnits.JANSKY) 

2581 uncjy = measurement.uncertainty.I.to_units(measures.FluxDensityUnits.JANSKY) 

2582 if fluxjy <= 0.0 or uncjy <= 0.0: 

2583 continue 

2584 snr = fluxjy / uncjy 

2585 minsnr = snr if minsnr is None else min(minsnr, snr) 

2586 nmeasured += 1 

2587 score1 = linear_score(float(snr), 5.0, snr_thresh, 0.66, 1.0) 

2588 minscore = min(minscore, score1) 

2589 score += score1 

2590 if score1 < 1.0: 

2591 low_snr_flux[fieldid].append(measurement.spw_id) 

2592 

2593 if nmeasured > 0: 

2594 score /= nmeasured 

2595 

2596 if nmeasured == 0: 

2597 score = 0.0 

2598 longmsg = 'No derived fluxes for %s ' % ms.basename 

2599 shortmsg = 'No derived fluxes' 

2600 elif minscore >= 1.0: 

2601 score = 1.0 

2602 longmsg = 'No low SNR derived fluxes for %s ' % ms.basename 

2603 shortmsg = 'No low SNR derived fluxes' 

2604 else: 

2605 # Report which field(s) and SpW(s) had low SNR. 

2606 fld_summaries = [f'field {fid}, SpW(s) {", ".join(str(s) for s in sorted(spwids))}' 

2607 for fid, spwids in sorted(low_snr_flux.items())] 

2608 longmsg = f'For {ms.basename}, the fractional uncertainty in the derived scaling factor is large' \ 

2609 f' (> {100/snr_thresh:.1f}%) for {"; ".join(fld_summaries)}. The calibrator may be too faint.' 

2610 shortmsg = 'Uncertainty in some of the derived fluxes' 

2611 

2612 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_derived_fluxes_snr', 

2613 metric_score=minsnr, 

2614 metric_units='Minimum SNR of derived flux measurement') 

2615 

2616 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, vis=ms.basename, origin=origin) 

2617

2619@log_qa 

2620def score_path_exists(mspath, path, pathtype): 

2621 """ 

2622 Score the existence of the path 

2623 1.0 if it exist 

2624 0.0 if it does not 

2625 """ 

2626 if os.path.exists(path): 

2627 score = 1.0 

2628 longmsg = 'The %s file %s for %s was created' % (pathtype, os.path.basename(path), os.path.basename(mspath)) 

2629 shortmsg = 'The %s file was created' % pathtype 

2630 else: 

2631 score = 0.0 

2632 longmsg = 'The %s file %s for %s was not created' % (pathtype, os.path.basename(path), os.path.basename(mspath)) 

2633 shortmsg = 'The %s file was not created' % pathtype 

2634 

2635 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_path_exists', 

2636 metric_score=bool(score), 

2637 metric_units='Path exists on disk') 

2638 

2639 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin) 

2640 

2641 

2642@log_qa 

2643def score_file_exists(filedir, filename, filetype): 

2644 """ 

2645 Score the existence of a products file 

2646 1.0 if it exists 

2647 0.0 if it does not 

2648 """ 

2649 if filename is None: 

2650 score = 1.0 

2651 longmsg = 'The %s file is undefined' % filetype 

2652 shortmsg = 'The %s file is undefined' % filetype 

2653 

2654 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_file_exists', 

2655 metric_score=None, 

2656 metric_units='No %s file to check' % filetype) 

2657 

2658 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin) 

2659 

2660 file_path = os.path.join(filedir, os.path.basename(filename)) 

2661 if os.path.exists(file_path): 

2662 score = 1.0 

2663 longmsg = 'The %s file has been exported' % filetype 

2664 shortmsg = 'The %s file has been exported' % filetype 

2665 else: 

2666 score = 0.0 

2667 longmsg = 'The %s file %s does not exist' % (filetype, os.path.basename(filename)) 

2668 shortmsg = 'The %s file does not exist' % filetype 

2669 

2670 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_file_exists', 

2671 metric_score=bool(score), 

2672 metric_units='File exists on disk') 

2673 

2674 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)

2756@log_qa 

2757def score_flagging_view_exists(filename, result): 

2758 """ 

2759 Assign a score of zero if the flagging view cannot be computed 

2760 """ 

2761 

2762 # By default, assume no flagging views were found. 

2763 score = 0.0 

2764 longmsg = 'No flagging views for %s' % filename 

2765 shortmsg = 'No flagging views' 

2766 

2767 # Check if this is a flagging result for a single metric, where 

2768 # the flagging view is stored directly in the result. 

2769 try: 

2770 view = result.view 

2771 if view: 

2772 score = 1.0 

2773 longmsg = 'Flagging views exist for %s' % filename 

2774 shortmsg = 'Flagging views exist' 

2775 except AttributeError: 

2776 pass 

2777 

2778 # Check if this flagging results contains multiple metrics, 

2779 # and look for flagging views among components. 

2780 try: 

2781 # Set score to 1 as soon as a single metric contains a 

2782 # valid flagging view. 

2783 for metricresult in result.components.values(): 

2784 view = metricresult.view 

2785 if view: 

2786 score = 1.0 

2787 longmsg = 'Flagging views exist for %s' % filename 

2788 shortmsg = 'Flagging views exist' 

2789 except AttributeError: 

2790 pass 

2791 

2792 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_flagging_view_exists', 

2793 metric_score=bool(score), 

2794 metric_units='Presence of flagging view') 

2795 

2796 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, vis=filename, origin=origin)

2908 

2909def get_line_ranges(lines: list[list[float | bool]]) -> list[tuple[int, int]]: 

2910 """Get valid line ranges from list of line properties. 

2911 

2912 Args: 

2913 lines: List of lines. Each line is expressed as at least three 

2914 values, [center, width, validity_flag], where the line 

2915 is regarded as valid if validity_flag is True. 

2916 

2917 Returns: 

2918 List of (start, end) channels for valid lines 

2919 """ 

2920 line_ranges = [] 

2921 for line in lines: 

2922 center, width, is_valid = line[:3] 

2923 if is_valid: 

2924 chan_left = int(np.floor(center - width / 2 + 0.5)) 

2925 chan_right = int(np.floor(center + width / 2 + 0.5)) 

2926 line_ranges.append((chan_left, chan_right)) 

2927 

2928 return line_ranges 

2929 

2930 

2931@log_qa 

2932def examine_sd_edge_lines(line_ranges: list[tuple[int, int]], nchan: int, edge: tuple[int, int] = (0, 0)) -> float: 

2933 """Examine the existence of lines at edge channels. 

2934 

2935 This function checks if there are lines that spans edge channels. 

2936 Excluded channels via edge parameter are taken into account. 

2937 

2938 Args: 

2939 line_ranges: List of line ranges 

2940 nchan: Number of channels 

2941 edge: Number of edge channels excluded from both sides 

2942 

2943 Returns: 

2944 True if there are lines that satisfy the condition above. 

2945 Otherwise, False. 

2946 """ 

2947 chan_leftmost = min(line[0] for line in line_ranges) 

2948 chan_rightmost = max(line[1] for line in line_ranges) 

2949 LOG.debug( 

2950 'leftmost %s, rightmost %s, nchan %s, edge (%s, %s)', 

2951 chan_leftmost, chan_rightmost, nchan, edge[0], edge[1] 

2952 ) 

2953 return chan_leftmost <= edge[0] or nchan - 1 - edge[1] <= chan_rightmost 

2954 

2955 

2956@log_qa 

2957def examine_sd_wide_lines(line_ranges: list[tuple[int, int]], nchan: int, edge: tuple[int, int] = (0, 0)) -> float: 

2958 """Examine the existence of wide lines. 

2959 

2960 This function returns True if there is a line with the width 

2961 exceeding 1/3 of spw bandwidth. If there are multiple lines 

2962 and their coverage exceeds the criterion *in total*, the 

2963 function also returns True. Otherwise, it returns False. 

2964 Excluded channels via edge parameter are taken into account. 

2965 

2966 Args: 

2967 line_ranges: List of line ranges 

2968 nchan: Number of channels 

2969 edge: Number of edge channels excluded from both sides 

2970 

2971 Returns: 

2972 True if wide line exists. Otherwise, Flase. Please see 

2973 the above description on more detailed explanation of 

2974 return value. 

2975 """ 

2976 # see PIPEREQ-304 for the origin of the value 

2977 fraction = 1 / 3 

2978 

2979 mask = np.zeros(nchan, dtype=np.uint8) 

2980 for line in line_ranges: 

2981 ch_start = max(line[0], 0) 

2982 ch_end = min(line[1], nchan - 1) + 1 

2983 mask[ch_start:ch_end] = 1 

2984 

2985 start = edge[0] 

2986 end = nchan - edge[1] 

2987 effective_nchan = nchan - sum(edge) 

2988 line_coverage = np.sum(mask[start:end]) 

2989 

2990 return line_coverage > effective_nchan * fraction 

2991 

2992 

2993def select_deviation_masks(deviation_masks: dict, reduction_group_member: 'MSReductionGroupMember') -> list[tuple[int, int]]: 

2994 """Select deviation masks that belongs to given reduction group member. 

2995 

2996 Args: 

2997 deviation_masks: List of all deviation masks 

2998 reduction_group_member: Reduction group member instance 

2999 

3000 Returns: 

3001 List of (start, end) channels for selected deviation masks 

3002 """ 

3003 ms_name = reduction_group_member.ms.basename 

3004 field_id = reduction_group_member.field_id 

3005 spw_id = reduction_group_member.spw_id 

3006 antenna_id = reduction_group_member.antenna_id 

3007 return deviation_masks[ms_name].get((field_id, antenna_id, spw_id), []) 

3008 

3009def channel_ranges_for_image(edge: tuple[int, int], nchan: int, sideband: int, ranges: list[tuple[int, int]]) -> list[tuple[int, int]]: 

3010 """Convert channel ranges in MS coordinate to those in image coordinate. 

3011 

3012 Frequency coordinates are different between MS and image product. 

3013 This method converts channel ranges in MS coordinate into the ranges 

3014 in image coordinate. The conversion includes the following operations. 

3015 

3016 - to reverse channels if spw is LSB 

3017 - to shift channels by the amount specified by edge parameter 

3018 

3019 Args: 

3020 edge: Number of edge channels excluded 

3021 nchan: Number of channels 

3022 sideband: 1 for USB, -1 for LSB 

3023 ranges: List of two tuples representing channel ranges 

3024 

3025 Returns: 

3026 Converted channel ranges 

3027 """ 

3028 edge_left, edge_right = edge 

3029 

3030 if sideband == -1: 

3031 # LSB 

3032 chan_offset = edge_right 

3033 

3034 def _reverse_range(x): 

3035 return nchan - 1 - x 

3036 

3037 _ranges_image = (map(_reverse_range, x[::-1]) for x in ranges) 

3038 

3039 else: 

3040 # USB 

3041 chan_offset = edge_left 

3042 

3043 _ranges_image = ranges 

3044 

3045 # offset channel ranges 

3046 def _offset_range(x): 

3047 return x - chan_offset 

3048 

3049 _ranges_image = (map(_offset_range, x) for x in _ranges_image) 

3050 

3051 return sorted(tuple(x) for x in _ranges_image) 

3052 

3053 

3054@log_qa 

3055def score_sd_line_detection(reduction_group: dict, result: 'SDBaselineResults') -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

3056 """Compute QA score based on detected lines and deviation/ATM mask overlaps. 

3057 

3058 QA scores are evaluated based on the line detection result for 

3059 each combination of spw and field individually. Scoring scheme of 

3060 individual results are as follows: 

3061 

3062 - Line detection: 

3063 - 0.55 if lines extend to edge channels 

3064 - 0.6 if lines cover more than 1/3 of SPW bandwidth 

3065 - 1.0 otherwise 

3066 - 0.8 if no lines were detected in any SPW/field (default) 

3067 

3068 - Deviation masks: 

3069 - 0.65 if deviation masks are present but do not overlap with lines 

3070 - 0.88 if deviation masks overlap with detected spectral lines 

3071 

3072 - Deviation mask and atmospheric lines: 

3073 - 0.88 if deviation masks overlap with atmospheric lines 

3074 

3075 Returned QAScore objects include metric values (channel ranges) and 

3076 informative messages that distinguish between spectral lines, 

3077 deviation masks, and atmospheric overlap. The function ensures that 

3078 at least one score is returned, even if no lines are detected. 

3079 

3080 Relevant JIRA tickets: 

3081 PIPE-2136 

3082 PIPE-2509 

3083 PIPE-2530 

3084 PIPEREQ-304 

3085 

3086 Args: 

3087 reduction_group: Reduction group 

3088 result: Result object generated by hsd_baseline stage 

3089 

3090 Returns: 

3091 List of QAScore objects derived from line detection results 

3092 and/or deviation masks, with atm lines, if available 

3093 """ 

3094 

3095 def mask_to_ranges(mask: np.ndarray) -> list[tuple[int,int]]: 

3096 """ 

3097 Convert a boolean channel mask into a list of contiguous channel ranges. 

3098 

3099 Parameters: 

3100 mask (np.ndarray): 1D boolean array where True indicates 

3101 channels to include. 

3102 

3103 Returns: 

3104 list[tuple[int, int]]: List of (start, end) tuples for each 

3105 contiguous run of True values in the mask. 

3106 """ 

3107 idx = np.where(mask)[0] 

3108 if idx.size == 0: 

3109 return [] 

3110 groups = np.split(idx, np.where(np.diff(idx) != 1)[0] + 1) 

3111 return [(grp[0], grp[-1]) for grp in groups] 

3112 

3113 def make_score(score_val: float, msg: str, metric_val: str, metric_units: str, 

3114 ms_name: str | None = None, field: str | None = None, spws: set[int] = set(), ants: set[str] = set()): 

3115 

3116 """ 

3117 Build a QAScore object for score_sd_line_detection. 

3118 

3119 Parameters: 

3120 score_val (float): The numeric QA score. 

3121 msg (str): Description of the QA result. 

3122 metric_val (str): The metric value of score. 

3123 metric_units (str): Units for the metric_value. 

3124 ms_name (str): Name of the Measurement Set (EB). (optional) 

3125 field (str): Field name (optional). 

3126 spws (set[int]): Set of spectral window IDs (optional). 

3127 ants (set[str]): Set of antenna names (optional). 

3128 

3129 Returns: 

3130 pqa.QAScore: A fully populated QAScore with long and short messages, 

3131 origin (metric name/score/units), and target selection. 

3132 """ 

3133 ms_str = f'EB {ms_name}' if ms_name else "" 

3134 field_str = f', Field {field}' if field else "" 

3135 spw_str = ', Spw ' + ', '.join(map(str, sorted(spws))) if spws else "" 

3136 ant_str = ', Antenna ' + ', '.join(sorted(ants)) if ants else "" 

3137 shortmsg = f'{msg}.' 

3138 longmsg = f'{msg} in {ms_str}{field_str}{spw_str}{ant_str}.' if ms_name or field or spws or ants else shortmsg 

3139 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_sd_line_detection', 

3140 metric_score=metric_val, 

3141 metric_units=metric_units) 

3142 selection = pqa.TargetDataSelection( 

3143 vis={ms_name} if ms_name else None, 

3144 spw=spws, 

3145 field={field} if field else None, 

3146 ant=ants, 

3147 intent={'TARGET'}) 

3148 return pqa.QAScore(score_val, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin, applies_to=selection) 

3149 

3150 # Precompute ATM masks per MS/SPW 

3151 atm_masks = {} 

3152 for bl in result.outcome['baselined']: 

3153 for mid in bl['members']: 

3154 rgm = reduction_group[bl['group_id']][mid] 

3155 ms = rgm.ms.origin_ms 

3156 if ms not in atm_masks: 

3157 if rgm.ms.antenna_array.name == 'NRO': 

3158 atm_masks.setdefault(ms, {}) 

3159 continue 

3160 

3161 spwsetup = sdatm.getSpecSetup(rgm.ms.basename) 

3162 spws = list(map(int, spwsetup['spwlist'])) 

3163 tau = sdatm.getCalAtmData(rgm.ms.basename, spws, spwsetup)[-2] 

3164 skylines = {spw: sdatm.getskylines(tau[spw], spw, spwsetup, fraclevel=0.3, minpeaklevel=0.05) for spw in spws} 

3165 atm_masks[ms] = {spw: sdatm.skysel(skylines[spw], linestouse='all') for spw in spws} 

3166 

3167 line_detection_scores, dm_scores = [], [] 

3168 

3169 # edge parameter for image channel mapping 

3170 _edge = result.outcome['edge'] 

3171 edge = (_edge, _edge) if isinstance(_edge, int) else tuple(_edge[:2]) 

3172 

3173 # Process each baseline for line detection and DM 

3174 for bl in result.outcome['baselined']: 

3175 reduction_group_id = bl['group_id'] 

3176 reduction_group_desc = reduction_group[reduction_group_id] 

3177 member_list = bl['members'] 

3178 field_name = reduction_group_desc.field_name 

3179 spw = reduction_group_desc[member_list[0]].spw 

3180 # sideband is 1 for USB, -1 for LSB 

3181 sideband = int(spw.sideband) 

3182 nchan = reduction_group_desc.nchan 

3183 lines = get_line_ranges(bl['lines']) 

3184 

3185 LOG.debug('Processing reduction group %s, field %s, spw %s', reduction_group_id, field_name, spw.id) 

3186 

3187 # spectral-line scoring 

3188 if len(lines) > 0: 

3189 # sort lines by left channel 

3190 lines.sort(key=operator.itemgetter(0)) 

3191 is_edge_line = examine_sd_edge_lines(lines, nchan, edge) 

3192 is_wide_line = examine_sd_wide_lines(lines, nchan, edge) 

3193 

3194 if is_edge_line and is_wide_line: 

3195 score = 0.55 # min(0.55, 0.6) 

3196 msg = 'Edge and wide lines were detected' 

3197 elif is_edge_line: 

3198 score = 0.55 

3199 msg = 'Edge line was detected' 

3200 elif is_wide_line: 

3201 score = 0.6 

3202 msg = 'Wide line was detected' 

3203 else: 

3204 # detected lines do not harm baseline subtraction 

3205 score = 1.0 

3206 msg = 'Line ranges were detected' 

3207 lines_image = channel_ranges_for_image(edge, nchan, sideband, lines) 

3208 metric_value = ';'.join([f'{left}~{right}' for left, right in lines_image]) 

3209 line_detection_scores.append(make_score(score, msg, metric_value, 

3210 'Channel range(s) of detected lines', 

3211 reduction_group_desc[member_list[0]].ms.origin_ms, field_name, 

3212 {reduction_group_desc[m].spw_id for m in member_list}, 

3213 {reduction_group_desc[m].antenna_name for m in member_list})) 

3214 

3215 # deviation-mask and ATM overlap 

3216 for mid in member_list: 

3217 rgm = reduction_group_desc[mid] 

3218 dmlist = select_deviation_masks(result.outcome['deviation_mask'], rgm) 

3219 if not dmlist: 

3220 continue 

3221 ndm = len(dmlist) 

3222 ms, spw = rgm.ms.origin_ms, rgm.spw_id 

3223 # build masks 

3224 dm_masks = np.zeros((ndm, nchan), bool) 

3225 for i, (l, r) in enumerate(dmlist): 

3226 dm_masks[i, l:r+1] = True 

3227 line_mask = np.zeros(nchan, bool) 

3228 for l, r in lines: 

3229 line_mask[l:r+1] = True 

3230 atm_mask = atm_masks[ms].get(spw, np.zeros(nchan, bool)) 

3231 

3232 # DM scoring 

3233 for dm_mask in dm_masks: 

3234 ranges = mask_to_ranges(dm_mask) 

3235 unit = 'Channel range(s) of deviation mask' 

3236 dm_atm = dm_mask & atm_mask 

3237 if np.any(line_mask & dm_mask): 

3238 score = 0.88 

3239 msg = 'Deviation mask overlapped with spectral lines' 

3240 LOG.debug( 

3241 'Deviation masks overlap with lines. ' 

3242 'Set deviation mask QA score to %s', score 

3243 ) 

3244 # ATM-DM overlap 

3245 elif np.any(dm_atm): 

3246 score = 0.88 

3247 msg = 'Deviation mask overlapped with atmospheric lines' 

3248 unit = 'Channel range(s) of DM/ATM/Spectral overlap' 

3249 LOG.debug( 

3250 'Deviation mask overlapped with atmospheric lines' 

3251 'Set atm overlap QA score to %s', score 

3252 ) 

3253 else: 

3254 score = 0.65 

3255 msg = 'Deviation mask was triggered' 

3256 LOG.debug( 

3257 'Found deviation mask with no overlap' 

3258 'Set deviation mask QA score to %s', score 

3259 ) 

3260 metric = ','.join(f'{l}~{r}' for l, r in ranges) 

3261 dm_scores.append(make_score(score, msg, metric, unit, 

3262 ms, field_name, {spw}, {rgm.antenna_name})) 

3263 

3264 if len(line_detection_scores) == 0: 

3265 # add new entry with score of 0.8 if no spectral lines 

3266 # were detected in any spws/fields 

3267 line_detection_scores.append(make_score(0.8, 'No line ranges were detected in all SPWs', 

3268 'N/A', 'Channel range(s) of detected lines')) 

3269 

3270 return line_detection_scores + dm_scores 

3271 

3272 

3273 

3274@log_qa 

3275def score_sd_baseline_quality(vis: str, source: str, ant: str, vspw: str, 

3276 pol: str, stat: list[tuple]) -> pqa.QAScore: 

3277 """ 

3278 Return Pipeline QA score of baseline quality. 

3279 

3280 Args: 

3281 vis: MS name 

3282 source: source name 

3283 ant: antenna name 

3284 vspw: virtual spw ID 

3285 pol: polarization 

3286 stat: a list of binned statistics 

3287 

3288 Returns: 

3289 Pipeline QA score of baseline quality. 

3290 """ 

3291 scores = [] 

3292 LOG.info(f'Statistics of {vis}: {source}, {ant}, {vspw}, {pol}') 

3293 # See PIPEREQ-168 for details of QA metrics. 

3294 # The values of bin_diff_ratio at the edges of ramp 

3295 ramp_range = (1.8, 3.6) 

3296 # The scores at the corresponding edges of ramp. These values are also 

3297 # adopted in extrapolation beyond ramp_range. 

3298 score_range = (1.0, 0.33) 

3299 metric_func = interpolate.interp1d(ramp_range, score_range, 

3300 kind='linear', bounds_error=False, 

3301 fill_value=score_range) 

3302 for s in stat: 

3303 diff_score = metric_func(s.bin_diff_ratio) 

3304 scores.append(diff_score) 

3305 LOG.info(f'rdiff = {s.bin_diff_ratio} -> score = {diff_score}') 

3306 final_score = np.nanmin(scores) 

3307 quality = 'Good' 

3308 if final_score <= 0.66: 

3309 quality='Poor' 

3310 elif final_score <= 0.9: 

3311 quality='Moderate' 

3312 shortmsg = f'{quality} baseline flatness' 

3313 longmsg = f'{quality} baseline flatness in {vis}, {source}, {ant}, virtual spw {vspw}, {pol}' 

3314 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_sd_baseline_quality', 

3315 metric_score=len(stat), 

3316 metric_units='Statistics of binned spectra') 

3317 

3318 return pqa.QAScore(final_score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin) 

3319 

3320 

3321@log_qa 

3322def score_checksources(mses, fieldname, spwid, imagename, rms, gfluxscale, gfluxscale_err): 

3323 """ 

3324 Score a single field image of a point source by comparing the source 

3325 reference position to the fitted position and the source reference flux 

3326 to the fitted flux. 

3327 

3328 The source is assumed to be near the center of the image. 

3329 The fit is performed using pixels in a circular regions 

3330 around the center of the image 

3331 """ 

3332 qa = casa_tools.quanta 

3333 me = casa_tools.measures 

3334 

3335 # Get the reference direction of the check source field 

3336 # There is at least one field with check source intent 

3337 # Protect against the same source having multiple fields 

3338 # with different intent. 

3339 # Assume that the same field as defined by its field name 

3340 # has the same direction in all the mses that contributed 

3341 # to the input image. Loop through the ms(s) and find the 

3342 # first occurrence of the specified field. Convert the 

3343 # direction to ICRS to match the default image coordinate 

3344 # system 

3345 

3346 refdirection = None 

3347 for ms in mses: 

3348 field = ms.get_fields(name=fieldname) 

3349 # No fields with the check source name. Should be 

3350 # impossible at this point but check just in case 

3351 if not field: 

3352 continue 

3353 # Find check field for that ms 

3354 chkfield = None 

3355 for fielditem in field: 

3356 if 'CHECK' not in fielditem.intents: 

3357 continue 

3358 chkfield = fielditem 

3359 break 

3360 # No matching check field for that ms, next ms 

3361 if chkfield is None: 

3362 continue 

3363 # Found field, get reference direction in ICRS coordinates 

3364 LOG.info('Using field name %s id %s to determine check source reference direction' % 

3365 (chkfield.name, str(chkfield.id))) 

3366 refdirection = me.measure(chkfield.mdirection, 'ICRS') 

3367 break 

3368 

3369 # Get the reference flux of the check source field 

3370 # Loop over all the ms(s) extracting the derived flux 

3371 # values for the specified field and spw. Set the reference 

3372 # flux to the maximum of these values. 

3373 reffluxes = [] 

3374 for ms in mses: 

3375 if not ms.derived_fluxes: 

3376 continue 

3377 for field_arg, measurements in ms.derived_fluxes.items(): 

3378 mfield = ms.get_fields(field_arg) 

3379 chkfield = None 

3380 for mfielditem in mfield: 

3381 if mfielditem.name != fieldname: 

3382 continue 

3383 if 'CHECK' not in mfielditem.intents: 

3384 continue 

3385 chkfield = mfielditem 

3386 break 

3387 # No matching check field for this ms 

3388 if chkfield is None: 

3389 continue 

3390 LOG.info('Using field name %s id %s to identify check source flux densities' % 

3391 (chkfield.name, str(chkfield.id))) 

3392 for measurement in sorted(measurements, key=lambda m: int(m.spw_id)): 

3393 if int(measurement.spw_id) != spwid: 

3394 continue 

3395 for stokes in ['I']: 

3396 try: 

3397 flux = getattr(measurement, stokes) 

3398 flux_jy = float(flux.to_units(measures.FluxDensityUnits.JANSKY)) 

3399 reffluxes.append(flux_jy) 

3400 except: 

3401 pass 

3402 

3403 # Use the maximum reference flux 

3404 if not reffluxes: 

3405 refflux = None 

3406 else: 

3407 median_flux = np.median(np.array(reffluxes)) 

3408 refflux = qa.quantity(median_flux, 'Jy') 

3409 

3410 # Do the fit and compute positions offsets and flux ratios 

3411 fitdict = checksource.checkimage(imagename, rms, refdirection, refflux) 

3412 

3413 msnames = ','.join(utils.remove_trailing_string(os.path.basename(ms.name), '.ms') for ms in mses) 

3414 

3415 # Compute the scores the default score is the geometric mean of 

3416 # the position and flux scores if both are available. 

3417 if not fitdict: 

3418 offset = None 

3419 offset_err = None 

3420 beams = None 

3421 beams_err = None 

3422 fitflux = None 

3423 fitflux_err = None 

3424 fitpeak = None 

3425 score = 0.34 

3426 longmsg = 'Check source fit failed for %s field %s spwid %d' % (msnames, fieldname, spwid) 

3427 shortmsg = 'Check source fit failed' 

3428 metric_score = 'N/A' 

3429 metric_units = 'Check source fit failed' 

3430 

3431 else: 

3432 offset = fitdict['positionoffset']['value'] * 1000.0 

3433 offset_err = fitdict['positionoffset_err']['value'] * 1000.0 

3434 beams = fitdict['beamoffset']['value'] 

3435 beams_err = fitdict['beamoffset_err']['value'] 

3436 fitflux = fitdict['fitflux']['value'] 

3437 fitflux_err = fitdict['fitflux_err']['value'] 

3438 fitpeak = fitdict['fitpeak']['value'] 

3439 shortmsg = 'Check source fit successful' 

3440 

3441 warnings = [] 

3442 

3443 offset_score = 0.0 

3444 offset_metric = 'N/A' 

3445 offset_unit = 'beams' 

3446 if beams is None: 

3447 warnings.append('unfitted offset') 

3448 else: 

3449 offset_score = max(0.33, 1.0 - min(1.0, beams)) 

3450 offset_metric = beams 

3451 if beams > 0.30: 

3452 warnings.append('large fitted offset of %.2f marcsec and %.2f synth beam' % (offset, beams)) 

3453 

3454 fitflux_score = 0.0 

3455 fitflux_metric = 'N/A' 

3456 fitflux_unit = 'fitflux/refflux' 

3457 if gfluxscale is None: 

3458 warnings.append('undefined gfluxscale result') 

3459 elif gfluxscale == 0.0: 

3460 warnings.append('gfluxscale value of 0.0 mJy') 

3461 else: 

3462 chk_fitflux_gfluxscale_ratio = fitflux * 1000. / gfluxscale 

3463 fitflux_score = max(0.33, 1.0 - abs(1.0 - chk_fitflux_gfluxscale_ratio)) 

3464 fitflux_metric = chk_fitflux_gfluxscale_ratio 

3465 if chk_fitflux_gfluxscale_ratio < 0.8: 

3466 warnings.append('low [Fitted / gfluxscale] Flux Density Ratio of %.2f' % (chk_fitflux_gfluxscale_ratio)) 

3467 

3468 fitpeak_score = 0.0 

3469 fitpeak_metric = 'N/A' 

3470 fitpeak_unit = 'fitpeak/fitflux' 

3471 if fitflux is None: 

3472 warnings.append('undefined check fit result') 

3473 elif fitflux == 0.0: 

3474 warnings.append('Fitted Flux Density value of 0.0 mJy') 

3475 else: 

3476 chk_fitpeak_fitflux_ratio = fitpeak / fitflux 

3477 fitpeak_score = max(0.33, 1.0 - abs(1.0 - (chk_fitpeak_fitflux_ratio))) 

3478 fitpeak_metric = chk_fitpeak_fitflux_ratio 

3479 if chk_fitpeak_fitflux_ratio < 0.7: 

3480 warnings.append('low Fitted [Peak Intensity / Flux Density] Ratio of %.2f' % (chk_fitpeak_fitflux_ratio)) 

3481 

3482 snr_msg = '' 

3483 if gfluxscale is not None and gfluxscale_err is not None: 

3484 if gfluxscale_err != 0.0: 

3485 chk_gfluxscale_snr = gfluxscale / gfluxscale_err 

3486 if chk_gfluxscale_snr < 20.: 

3487 snr_msg = ', however, the S/N of the gfluxscale measurement is low' 

3488 

3489 if any(np.array([offset_score, fitflux_score, fitpeak_score]) < 1.0): 

3490 score = math.sqrt(offset_score * fitflux_score * fitpeak_score) 

3491 else: 

3492 score = offset_score * fitflux_score * fitpeak_score 

3493 metric_score = [offset_metric, fitflux_metric, fitpeak_metric] 

3494 metric_units = '%s, %s, %s' % (offset_unit, fitflux_unit, fitpeak_unit) 

3495 

3496 if warnings != []: 

3497 longmsg = 'EB %s field %s spwid %d: has a %s%s' % (msnames, fieldname, spwid, ' and a '.join(warnings), snr_msg) 

3498 else: 

3499 if score <= 0.9: 

3500 longmsg = 'EB %s field %s spwid %d: Check source fit not optimal' % (msnames, fieldname, spwid) 

3501 else: 

3502 longmsg = 'EB %s field %s spwid %d: Check source fit successful' % (msnames, fieldname, spwid) 

3503 

3504 if score <= 0.9: 

3505 shortmsg = 'Check source fit not optimal' 

3506 

3507 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='ScoreChecksources', 

3508 metric_score=metric_score, 

3509 metric_units=metric_units) 

3510 

3511 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin), offset, offset_err, beams, beams_err, fitflux, fitflux_err, fitpeak 

3512 

3513 

3514@log_qa 

3515def score_multiply(scores_list): 

3516 score = functools.reduce(operator.mul, scores_list, 1.0) 

3517 longmsg = 'Multiplication of scores.' 

3518 shortmsg = 'Multiplication of scores.' 

3519 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_multiply', 

3520 metric_score=len(scores_list), 

3521 metric_units='Number of multiplied scores.') 

3522 

3523 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin) 

3524 

3525 

3526@log_qa 

3527def score_sd_skycal_elevation_difference(ms, resultdict, threshold=3.0): 

3528 """ 

3529 """ 

3530 field_ids = list(resultdict.keys()) 

3531 metric_score = [] 

3532 el_threshold = threshold 

3533 lmsg_list = [] 

3534 for field_id in field_ids: 

3535 field = ms.fields[field_id] 

3536 if field_id not in resultdict: 

3537 continue 

3538 

3539 eldiffant = resultdict[field_id] 

3540 warned_antennas = set() 

3541 for antenna_id, eldiff in eldiffant.items(): 

3542 for spw_id, eld in eldiff.items(): 

3543 preceding = eld.eldiff0 

3544 subsequent = eld.eldiff1 

3545 # LOG.info('field {} antenna {} spw {} preceding={}'.format(field_id, antenna_id, spw_id, preceding)) 

3546 # LOG.info('field {} antenna {} spw {} subsequent={}'.format(field_id, antenna_id, spw_id, subsequent)) 

3547 max_pred = None 

3548 max_subq = None 

3549 if len(preceding) > 0: 

3550 max_pred = np.abs(preceding).max() 

3551 metric_score.append(max_pred) 

3552 if max_pred >= el_threshold: 

3553 warned_antennas.add(antenna_id) 

3554 if len(subsequent) > 0: 

3555 max_subq = np.abs(subsequent).max() 

3556 metric_score.append(max_subq) 

3557 if max_subq >= el_threshold: 

3558 warned_antennas.add(antenna_id) 

3559 LOG.debug('field {} antenna {} spw {} metric_score {}'.format(field_id, antenna_id, spw_id, metric_score)) 

3560 

3561 if len(warned_antennas) > 0: 

3562 antenna_names = ', '.join([ms.antennas[a].name for a in warned_antennas]) 

3563 lmsg_list.append( 

3564 'field {} (antennas {})'.format(field.name, antenna_names) 

3565 ) 

3566 

3567 if len(lmsg_list) > 0: 

3568 longmsg = 'Elevation difference between ON and OFF exceeds threshold ({}deg) for {}: {}'.format( 

3569 el_threshold, 

3570 ms.basename, 

3571 ', '.join(lmsg_list) 

3572 ) 

3573 else: 

3574 longmsg = 'Elevation difference between ON and OFF is below threshold ({}deg) for {}'.format( 

3575 el_threshold, 

3576 ms.basename 

3577 ) 

3578 

3579 # CAS-11054: it is decided that we do not calculate QA score based on elevation difference for Cycle 6 

3580 # PIPE-246: we implement QA score based on elevation difference for Cycle 7. 

3581 # requirement is that score is 0.8 if elevation difference is larger than 3deg. 

3582 # make sure threshold is 3deg 

3583 assert el_threshold == 3.0 

3584 max_metric_score = np.max(metric_score) 

3585 # lower the score if elevation difference exceeds 3deg 

3586 score = 1.0 if max_metric_score < el_threshold else 0.8 

3587 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='OnOffElevationDifference', 

3588 metric_score=max_metric_score, 

3589 metric_units='deg') 

3590 

3591 if score < 1.0: 

3592 shortmsg = 'Elevation difference between ON and OFF exceeds {}deg'.format(el_threshold) 

3593 else: 

3594 shortmsg = 'Elevation difference between ON and OFF is below {}deg'.format(el_threshold) 

3595 

3596 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin, vis=ms.basename) 

3597 

3598 

3599def log_edge_channels( 

3600 imagename: str, 

3601 nchan: int, 

3602 edge_count_lower: int, 

3603 edge_count_upper: int 

3604): 

3605 """Print proper log message for detected edge channels. 

3606 

3607 Args: 

3608 imagename: Name of the input image 

3609 nchan: Number of channels in the image 

3610 edge_count_lower: Number of edge channels 

3611 excluded from the lower frequency side 

3612 edge_count_upper: Number of edge channels 

3613 excluded from the higher frequency side 

3614 """ 

3615 LOG.debug("nchan %s: edge lower %s, upper %s", 

3616 nchan, edge_count_lower, edge_count_upper) 

3617 edge_chan_list = [] 

3618 # lower edge channels 

3619 if edge_count_lower == 1: 

3620 edge_chan_list.append("0") 

3621 elif edge_count_lower > 1: 

3622 edge_chan_list.append(f"0~{edge_count_lower - 1}") 

3623 

3624 # upper edge channels 

3625 if edge_count_lower == nchan: 

3626 # all the channels are invalid, should be covered 

3627 # by edge_count_lower alone 

3628 pass 

3629 elif edge_count_upper == 1: 

3630 edge_chan_list.append(f"{nchan - 1}") 

3631 elif edge_count_upper > 1: 

3632 edge_chan_list.append( 

3633 f"{nchan - edge_count_upper}~{nchan - 1}" 

3634 ) 

3635 

3636 # emit log 

3637 LOG.info( 

3638 f"masked pixel QA for {imagename}: " 

3639 f"detected edge channels: {';'.join(edge_chan_list)}" 

3640 ) 

3641 

3642 

3643def generate_metric_mask( 

3644 context: Context, 

3645 result: SDImagingResultItem, 

3646 cs: coordsys, 

3647 mask: np.ndarray 

3648) -> np.ndarray: 

3649 """ 

3650 Generate boolean mask array for metric calculation in 

3651 score_sdimage_masked_pixels. If image pixel contains 

3652 observed points, mask will be True. Otherwise, mask is 

3653 False. 

3654 

3655 Arguments: 

3656 context: Pipeline context 

3657 result: result item created by hsd_imaging 

3658 cs: CASA coordsys tool 

3659 mask: image mask 

3660 

3661 Returns: 

3662 bool array -- metric mask (True: valid, False: invalid) 

3663 """ 

3664 outcome = result.outcome 

3665 org_direction = outcome['image'].org_direction 

3666 imshape = mask.shape 

3667 

3668 file_index = np.asarray(outcome['file_index']) 

3669 antenna_list = np.asarray(outcome['assoc_antennas']) 

3670 field_list = np.asarray(outcome['assoc_fields']) 

3671 vspw_list = np.asarray(outcome['assoc_spws']) 

3672 

3673 mses = context.observing_run.measurement_sets 

3674 # avoid processing the same MS multiple times 

3675 unique_file_index = np.unique(file_index) 

3676 

3677 refval = cs.referencevalue() 

3678 units = cs.units() 

3679 metric_mask = np.zeros(imshape, dtype=bool) 

3680 

3681 for ms_id in unique_file_index: 

3682 target_ms = mses[ms_id] 

3683 origin_basename = os.path.basename(target_ms.origin_ms) 

3684 datatable_name = os.path.join( 

3685 context.observing_run.ms_datatable_name, 

3686 origin_basename 

3687 ) 

3688 rotable_name = os.path.join(datatable_name, 'RO') 

3689 _index = np.where(file_index == ms_id) 

3690 if len(_index[0]) == 0: 

3691 continue 

3692 

3693 _antlist = antenna_list[_index] 

3694 _fieldlist = field_list[_index] 

3695 _vspwlist = vspw_list[_index] 

3696 

3697 # Here, we are trying to process data with the same field 

3698 # and spw in one MS but from different antennas. Therefore, 

3699 # field and spw should be unique in the list. 

3700 field_id = _fieldlist[0] # should be unique 

3701 if not np.all(_fieldlist == field_id): 

3702 LOG.warning( 

3703 f"Multiple fields found in MS {target_ms.basename}:" 

3704 f" {_fieldlist}. Skip evaluating." 

3705 ) 

3706 continue 

3707 vspw_id = _vspwlist[0] # should be unique 

3708 if not np.all(_vspwlist == vspw_id): 

3709 LOG.warning( 

3710 f"Multiple SPWs found in MS {target_ms.basename}:" 

3711 f" {_vspwlist}. Skip evaluating." 

3712 ) 

3713 continue 

3714 spw_id = context.observing_run.virtual2real_spw_id(vspw_id, target_ms) 

3715 

3716 with casa_tools.TableReader(rotable_name) as tb: 

3717 taql = f'SRCTYPE==0 && ANTENNA IN {utils.list_to_str(_antlist)} && FIELD_ID == {field_id} && IF == {spw_id}' 

3718 LOG.debug("MS: %s, TaQL string: %s", target_ms.basename, taql) 

3719 tsel = tb.query(taql) 

3720 ofs_ra = tsel.getcol('OFS_RA') 

3721 ofs_dec = tsel.getcol('OFS_DEC') 

3722 origin_ms_rows = tsel.getcol('ROW') 

3723 tsel.close() 

3724 

3725 if org_direction is None: 

3726 ra_deg = ofs_ra 

3727 dec_deg = ofs_dec 

3728 else: 

3729 ra_deg = np.empty(len(ofs_ra), dtype=float) 

3730 dec_deg = np.empty(len(ofs_dec), dtype=float) 

3731 for i, rr, dd in zip(range(len(ofs_ra)), ofs_ra, ofs_dec): 

3732 shift_ra, shift_dec = direction_recover(rr, dd, org_direction) 

3733 ra_deg[i] = shift_ra 

3734 dec_deg[i] = shift_dec 

3735 

3736 rowmap = sdutils.make_row_map_between_ms( 

3737 context.observing_run.get_ms(target_ms.origin_ms), 

3738 target_ms.name 

3739 ) 

3740 

3741 with casa_tools.TableReader(target_ms.name) as tb: 

3742 flag = map( 

3743 lambda irow: tb.getcell('FLAG', rowmap[irow]), 

3744 origin_ms_rows 

3745 ) 

3746 # invert flag: True for valid data 

3747 ms_mask = map( 

3748 lambda f: np.logical_not(f), 

3749 flag 

3750 ) 

3751 # data will contribute to the image if all polarizations are valid 

3752 ms_mask_collapsed_pol = map( 

3753 lambda f: np.all(f, axis=0), 

3754 ms_mask 

3755 ) 

3756 # data will contribute to the image if there are any valid channels 

3757 ms_mask_per_row = map( 

3758 lambda f: np.any(f), 

3759 ms_mask_collapsed_pol 

3760 ) 

3761 # validity mask for each row: True for valid data 

3762 validity_mask = np.fromiter(ms_mask_per_row, dtype=bool) 

3763 

3764 # world-pixel conversion using cs.topixelmany 

3765 ra_deg = ra_deg[validity_mask] 

3766 dec_deg = dec_deg[validity_mask] 

3767 

3768 # skip if no valid data exists 

3769 if len(ra_deg) == 0: 

3770 LOG.info( 

3771 f'No valid data in MS {target_ms.basename},' 

3772 f' field {field_id}, spw {spw_id}, antenna {_antlist}.' 

3773 f' Excluding the MS from mask evaluation.' 

3774 ) 

3775 continue 

3776 

3777 # unit should be either 'rad' or 'deg' 

3778 deg2rad = np.pi / 180.0 

3779 ra = ra_deg * deg2rad if units[0] == 'rad' else ra_deg 

3780 dec = dec_deg * deg2rad if units[1] == 'rad' else dec_deg 

3781 wpol = np.zeros(len(ra), dtype=float) 

3782 wfreq = np.zeros(len(ra), dtype=float) + refval['numeric'][3] 

3783 world_array = np.stack((ra, dec, wpol, wfreq)) 

3784 pixel_array = cs.topixelmany(world_array)['numeric'] 

3785 px = pixel_array[0] 

3786 py = pixel_array[1] 

3787 

3788 for x, y in zip(map(int, np.round(px)), map(int, np.round(py))): 

3789 if 0 <= x and x <= imshape[0] - 1 and 0 <= y and y <= imshape[1] - 1: 

3790 metric_mask[x, y, :, :] = True 

3791 

3792 # exclude edge channels 

3793 imagename = outcome['image'].imagename 

3794 nchan = metric_mask.shape[3] 

3795 edge_count_lower, edge_count_upper = detect_edge_channels(mask) 

3796 log_edge_channels(imagename, nchan, edge_count_lower, edge_count_upper) 

3797 if edge_count_lower > 0: 

3798 metric_mask[:, :, :, :edge_count_lower] = False 

3799 if edge_count_upper > 0: 

3800 metric_mask[:, :, :, -edge_count_upper:] = False 

3801 

3802 return metric_mask 

3803 

3804 

3805def detect_edge_channels(mask: np.ndarray) -> tuple[int, int]: 

3806 """Detect list of edge channels to be excluded from QA evaluation. 

3807 

3808 There are a few edge channels that have less valid spatial pixels 

3809 than other spectral channels, probably due to the effect of frame 

3810 conversion from TOPO to LSRK with progressively varying time stamp. 

3811 Raster OTF scan without frequency tracking can cause this effect. 

3812 

3813 Other possible reason is edge channel flagging by hsd_flagdata 

3814 and/or hsd_tsysflag. 

3815 

3816 This function detects such edge channels by calculating the median 

3817 number of valid spatial pixels in each channel. Consecutive 

3818 channels with less valid spatial pixels than the median are 

3819 regarded as edge channels. 

3820 

3821 Args: 

3822 mask: boolean numpy array of shape (nx, ny, npol, nchan) 

3823 

3824 Returns: 

3825 Number of edge channels excluded from lower and upper 

3826 side of the spectral axis 

3827 """ 

3828 num_valid_pixels = np.sum(mask, axis=(0, 1, 2)) 

3829 nchan = len(num_valid_pixels) 

3830 # PIPE-1727 threshold for edge channels should be strict, 

3831 # no tolerance using stddev nor MAD 

3832 median_num_valid_pixels = np.median(num_valid_pixels) 

3833 LOG.debug( 

3834 "typical number of valid pixels %s", 

3835 median_num_valid_pixels 

3836 ) 

3837 threshold = median_num_valid_pixels 

3838 edge_count_lower = 0 

3839 for i in range(nchan): 

3840 if num_valid_pixels[i] < threshold: 

3841 edge_count_lower += 1 

3842 else: 

3843 break 

3844 edge_count_upper = 0 

3845 for i in range(nchan - 1, -1, -1): 

3846 if num_valid_pixels[i] < threshold: 

3847 edge_count_upper += 1 

3848 else: 

3849 break 

3850 

3851 return edge_count_lower, edge_count_upper 

3852 

3853 

3854def direction_recover( ra, dec, org_direction ): 

3855 me = casa_tools.measures 

3856 qa = casa_tools.quanta 

3857 

3858 direction = me.direction( org_direction['refer'], 

3859 str(ra)+'deg', str(dec)+'deg' ) 

3860 zero_direction = me.direction( org_direction['refer'], '0deg', '0deg' ) 

3861 offset = me.separation( zero_direction, direction ) 

3862 posang = me.posangle( zero_direction, direction ) 

3863 new_direction = me.shift( org_direction, offset=offset, pa=posang ) 

3864 new_ra = qa.convert( new_direction['m0'], 'deg' )['value'] 

3865 new_dec = qa.convert( new_direction['m1'], 'deg' )['value'] 

3866 

3867 return new_ra, new_dec 

3868 

3869 

3870@log_qa 

3871def score_sdimage_masked_pixels(context: Context, result: SDImagingResultItem) -> pqa.QAScore: 

3872 """ 

3873 Evaluate QA score based on the fraction of masked pixels in image. 

3874 

3875 Requirements (PIPE-249): 

3876 - calculate the number of masked pixels in image 

3877 - search area should be the extent of pointing direction 

3878 - QA score should be 

3879 1.0 (if the nuber of masked pixel == 0) 

3880 0.5 (if any of the pixel in pointing area is masked) 

3881 0.0 (if 10% of the pixels in pointing area are masked) 

3882 *linearly interpolate between 0.5 and 0.0 

3883 

3884 Arguments: 

3885 context: Pipeline context 

3886 result: Imaging result instance 

3887 

3888 Returns: 

3889 QAScore -- QAScore instance holding the score based on number of 

3890 masked pixels in image 

3891 """ 

3892 # metric score is a fraction of masked pixels 

3893 result_item = result.outcome 

3894 image_item = result_item['image'] 

3895 imagename = image_item.imagename 

3896 

3897 LOG.debug('imagename = {}'.format(imagename)) 

3898 with casa_tools.ImageReader(imagename) as ia: 

3899 # get mask 

3900 # Mask Definition: True is valid, False is invalid. 

3901 mask = ia.getchunk(getmask=True) 

3902 

3903 imageshape = ia.shape() 

3904 

3905 # cs represents coordinate system of the image 

3906 cs = ia.coordsys() 

3907 

3908 # image shape: (lon, lat, stokes, freq) 

3909 LOG.debug('image shape: {}'.format(list(imageshape))) 

3910 

3911 try: 

3912 # metric_mask is boolean array that defines the region to be excluded 

3913 # True: included in the metric calculation 

3914 # False: excluded from the metric calculation 

3915 metric_mask = generate_metric_mask(context, result, cs, mask) 

3916 finally: 

3917 # done using coordsys tool 

3918 cs.done() 

3919 

3920 # calculate metric_score 

3921 total_pixels = mask[metric_mask] 

3922 LOG.debug('Total number of pixels to be included in: {}'.format(len(total_pixels))) 

3923 masked_pixels = total_pixels[total_pixels == False] 

3924 if len(total_pixels) == 0: 

3925 LOG.warning('No pixels associated with pointing data exist. QA score will be zero.') 

3926 metric_score = -1.0 

3927 else: 

3928 masked_fraction = float(len(masked_pixels)) / float(len(total_pixels)) 

3929 LOG.debug('Number of masked pixels: {} fraction {}'.format(len(masked_pixels), masked_fraction)) 

3930 metric_score = masked_fraction 

3931 

3932 # score should be evaluated from metric score 

3933 lmsg = '' 

3934 smsg = '' 

3935 score = 0.0 

3936 metric_score_threshold = 0.1 

3937 metric_score_max = 1.0 

3938 metric_score_min = 0.0 

3939 

3940 # convert score and threshold for logging purpose 

3941 frac2percentage = lambda x: '{:.4g}%'.format(x * 100) 

3942 imbasename = os.path.basename(imagename.rstrip('/')) 

3943 

3944 if metric_score > metric_score_max: 

3945 # metric_score should not exceed 1.0. something wrong. 

3946 _x = frac2percentage(metric_score_max) 

3947 lmsg = '{}: fraction of number of masked pixels should not exceed {}. something went wrong.'.format(imbasename, _x) 

3948 smsg = 'metric value out of range.' 

3949 score = 0.0 

3950 elif metric_score < metric_score_min: 

3951 lmsg = '{}: No pixels associated with pointing data exist. something went wrong.'.format(imbasename) 

3952 smsg = 'metric value out of range.' 

3953 score = 0.0 

3954 elif metric_score == metric_score_min: 

3955 lmsg = 'All examined pixels in image {} are valid.'.format(imbasename) 

3956 smsg = 'All examined pixels are valid.' 

3957 score = 1.0 

3958 elif metric_score > metric_score_threshold: 

3959 _x = frac2percentage(metric_score_threshold) 

3960 _y = frac2percentage(metric_score) 

3961 lmsg = 'Fraction of masked pixels in image {} is {}, exceeding threshold value ({}).'.format(imbasename, _y, _x) 

3962 smsg = 'More than {} of image pixels are masked.'.format(_x) 

3963 score = 0.0 

3964 else: 

3965 # interpolate between 0.5 and 0.0 

3966 _x = frac2percentage(metric_score) 

3967 lmsg = 'Fraction of masked pixels in image {} is {}.'.format(imbasename, _x) 

3968 smsg = '{} of image pixels are masked.'.format(_x) 

3969 smax = 0.5 

3970 mmax = 0.0 

3971 smin = 0.0 

3972 mmin = 0.1 

3973 score = (smax - smin) / (mmax - mmin) * (metric_score - mmin) + smin 

3974 

3975 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='SingleDishImageMaskedPixels', 

3976 metric_score=metric_score, 

3977 metric_units='Fraction of masked pixels in image') 

3978 

3979 return pqa.QAScore(score, 

3980 longmsg=lmsg, 

3981 shortmsg=smsg, 

3982 origin=origin) 

3983

3985def score_sd_line_emission_off_range_at_peak(context: Context, result: SDImagingResultItem) -> pqa.QAScore: 

3986 """Evaluate QA score based on the detection of off-line-range emission at peak. 

3987 

3988 Requirements (PIPE-2416): 

3989 - QA score should be 

3990 - 0.6 if significant off-line-range emission is detected at peak 

3991 - 1.0 if no significant off-line-range emission is detected at peak 

3992 

3993 Args: 

3994 context: Pipeline context 

3995 result: Imaging result instance 

3996 

3997 Returns: 

3998 QAScore -- QAScore instance holding the score based on the Requirements 

3999 """ 

4000 emission_off_range_at_peak = result.outcome.get('line_emission_off_range_at_peak', False) 

4001 imageitem = result.outcome['image'] 

4002 field = imageitem.sourcename 

4003 spw = ','.join(map(str, np.unique(imageitem.spwlist))) 

4004 if emission_off_range_at_peak: 

4005 lmsg = (f'Field {field} Spw {spw}: ' 

4006 'Significant off-line-range emission is detected at peak.') 

4007 smsg = 'Significant off-line-range emission is detected at peak.' 

4008 score = 0.6 

4009 else: 

4010 lmsg = (f'Field {field} Spw {spw}: ' 

4011 'No significant off-line-range emission is detected at peak.') 

4012 smsg = 'No significant off-line-range emission is detected at peak.' 

4013 score = 1.0 

4014 

4015 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='line_emission_off_range_at_peak', 

4016 metric_score=score, 

4017 metric_units='') 

4018 selection = pqa.TargetDataSelection(spw=set(result.outcome['assoc_spws']), 

4019 field=set(result.outcome['assoc_fields']), 

4020 intent={'TARGET'}, 

4021 pol={'I'}) 

4022 return pqa.QAScore(score, 

4023 longmsg=lmsg, 

4024 shortmsg=smsg, 

4025 origin=origin, 

4026 applies_to=selection)

4073@log_qa 

4074def score_sdimage_contamination(context: Context, result: SDImagingResultItem) -> pqa.QAScore: 

4075 """Evaluate QA score based on the absorption feature in the image. 

4076 

4077 If there is an emission at OFF_SOURCE position (contamination), 

4078 it is emerged as an absorption feature in the calibrated spectra. 

4079 Therefore, this QA score utilizes any significant absorption 

4080 features as an indicator of potential contamination. 

4081 

4082 Requirements (PIPE-2066): 

4083 - QA score should be 

4084 - 0.65 if absorption feature exists 

4085 - 1.0 if absorption feature does not exist 

4086 

4087 Args: 

4088 context: Pipeline context 

4089 result: Imaging result instance 

4090 

4091 Returns: 

4092 QAScore -- QAScore instance holding the score based on the 

4093 existence of the absorption feature in the image 

4094 """ 

4095 contaminated = result.outcome.get('contaminated', False) 

4096 imageitem = result.outcome['image'] 

4097 field = imageitem.sourcename 

4098 spw = ','.join(map(str, np.unique(imageitem.spwlist))) 

4099 if contaminated: 

4100 lmsg = (f'Field {field} Spw {spw}: ' 

4101 'Possible astronomical line contamination was detected. ' 

4102 'Please check the contamination plots.') 

4103 smsg = 'Possible astronomical line contamination was detected.' 

4104 score = 0.65 

4105 else: 

4106 lmsg = (f'Field {field} Spw {spw}: ' 

4107 'No astronomical line contamintaion was detected.') 

4108 smsg = 'No astronomical line contamination was detected.' 

4109 score = 1.0 

4110 

4111 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='SingleDishImageContamination', 

4112 metric_score=contaminated, 

4113 metric_units='Sign of possible line contamination') 

4114 selection = pqa.TargetDataSelection(spw=set(result.outcome['assoc_spws']), 

4115 field=set(result.outcome['assoc_fields']), 

4116 intent={'TARGET'}, 

4117 pol={'I'}) 

4118 return pqa.QAScore(score, 

4119 longmsg=lmsg, 

4120 shortmsg=smsg, 

4121 origin=origin, 

4122 applies_to=selection)

4125@log_qa 

4126def score_gfluxscale_k_spw(vis, field, spw_id, k_spw, ref_spw): 

4127 """ Convert internal spw_id-spw_id consistency ratio to a QA score. 

4128 

4129 See CAS-10792 for full specification. 

4130 See PIPE-644 for update to restrict range of scores. 

4131 

4132 k_spw is equal to the ratio: 

4133 

4134 calibrated visibility flux / catalogue flux 

4135 k_spw = -------------------------------------------------------------------- 

4136 (calibrated visibility flux / catalogue flux) for highest SNR window 

4137 

4138 Q_spw = abs(1 - k_spw) 

4139 

4140 If Q_spw < 0.1 then QA score = 1.0 (green) 

4141 If 0.1 <= Q_spw < 0.2 then QA score = 0.75 (Blue/below standard) 

4142 If 0.2 <= Q_spw then QA score = 0.5 (Yellow/warning) 

4143 

4144 :param k_spw: numeric k_spw ratio, as per spec 

4145 :param vis: name of measurement set to which k_spw applies 

4146 :param field: field domain object to which k_spw applies 

4147 :param spw_id: name of spectral window to which k_spw applies 

4148 :return: QA score 

4149 """ 

4150 q_spw = abs(1-k_spw) 

4151 if q_spw < 0.1: 

4152 score = 1.0 

4153 elif q_spw < 0.2: 

4154 score = 0.75 

4155 else: 

4156 score = 0.5 

4157 

4158 longmsg = ('Ratio of <i>S</i><sub>calibrated</sub>/<i>S</i><sub>catalogue</sub> for {} ({}) spw {} in {} differs by' 

4159 ' {:.0%} from the ratio for the highest SNR spw ({})' 

4160 ''.format(utils.dequote(field.name), ','.join(field.intents), spw_id, vis, q_spw, ref_spw)) 

4161 shortmsg = 'Internal spw-spw consistency' 

4162 

4163 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_gfluxscale_k_spw', 

4164 metric_score=float(k_spw), 

4165 metric_units='Number of spws with missing SNR measurements') 

4166 

4167 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, vis=vis, origin=origin, 

4168 applies_to=pqa.TargetDataSelection(vis={vis}, field={field.id}, spw={spw_id})) 

4169

4171@log_qa 

4172def score_science_spw_names(mses, virtual_science_spw_names): 

4173 """ 

4174 Check that all MSs have the same set of spw names. If this is 

4175 not the case, the virtual spw mapping will not work. 

4176 """ 

4177 

4178 score = 1.0 

4179 msgs = [] 

4180 for ms in mses: 

4181 spw_msgs = [] 

4182 for s in ms.get_spectral_windows(science_windows_only=True): 

4183 if s.name not in virtual_science_spw_names: 

4184 score = 0.0 

4185 spw_msgs.append('{0} (ID {1})'.format(s.name, s.id)) 

4186 if spw_msgs != []: 

4187 msgs.append('Science spw names {0} of EB {1} do not match spw names of first EB.' 

4188 ''.format(','.join(spw_msgs), os.path.basename(ms.name).replace('.ms', ''))) 

4189 

4190 if msgs == []: 

4191 longmsg = 'Science spw names match virtual spw lookup table' 

4192 shortmsg = 'Science spw names match' 

4193 else: 

4194 longmsg = '{0} Virtual spw ID mapping will not work.'.format(' '.join(msgs)) 

4195 shortmsg = 'Science spw names do not match' 

4196 

4197 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_spwnames', 

4198 metric_score=score, 

4199 metric_units='spw names match virtual spw name lookup table') 

4200 

4201 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)

4217 

4218@log_qa 

4219def score_polcal_gain_ratio(session_name: str, ant_names: dict, xyratio_result: GaincalResults, 

4220 threshold: float = 0.1) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4221 """ 

4222 This QA heuristic inspects the gain ratios in an X/Y gain ratio caltable 

4223 and creates a score based on how large the deviation from one is. 

4224 

4225 Args: 

4226 session_name: name of session being evaluated. 

4227 ant_names: dictionary mapping antenna IDs to names. 

4228 xyratio_result: Gaincal task result object containing the 

4229 CalApplication for the caltable to analyze. 

4230 threshold: threshold used to determine whether the gain ratio deviates 

4231 too much from 1 (resulting in a lowered score). 

4232 Returns: 

4233 List of QAScore objects. 

4234 """ 

4235 scores = [] 

4236 # Score each caltable in result. 

4237 for calapp in xyratio_result.final: 

4238 # Retrieve data from caltable. 

4239 with casa_tools.TableReader(calapp.gaintable) as table: 

4240 gains = np.squeeze(table.getcol('CPARAM')) 

4241 spws = table.getcol('SPECTRAL_WINDOW_ID') 

4242 ants = table.getcol('ANTENNA1') 

4243 

4244 # Score each SpW separately. 

4245 for spwid in sorted(set(spws)): 

4246 ind_spw = np.where(spws == spwid)[0] 

4247 ratios = np.abs(gains[0, ind_spw]) / np.abs(gains[1, ind_spw]) 

4248 ind_bad = np.where(np.abs(1 - ratios) > threshold)[0] 

4249 

4250 if len(ind_bad) > 0: 

4251 score = 0.65 

4252 ant_str = utils.commafy([f"{ant_names[i]} (#{i})" for i in ants[ind_bad]], quotes=False) 

4253 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has gain ratios deviate from 1 by more than {threshold} for SpW" \ 

4254 f" {spwid}, antenna(s) {ant_str}" 

4255 shortmsg = "Large gain ratio deviation" 

4256 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_gain_ratio', 

4257 metric_score=score, 

4258 metric_units='gain ratio') 

4259 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

4260 

4261 # If no large deviations in gain ratio are found, then create a good score. 

4262 if not scores: 

4263 score = 1.0 

4264 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has gain ratios with deviations from 1 <= the threshold of {threshold}" \ 

4265 f" for all SpWs and all antennas." 

4266 shortmsg = "Gain ratio" 

4267 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_gain_ratio', 

4268 metric_score=score, 

4269 metric_units='gain ratio') 

4270 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

4271 

4272 return scores 

4273 

4274 

4275@log_qa 

4276def score_polcal_gain_ratio_rms(session_name: str, gain_ratio_rms: tuple[list, list], threshold: float = 0.02) \ 

4277 -> pqa.QAScore: 

4278 """ 

4279 This QA heuristic receives gain ratio RMS corresponding to scan IDs, and 

4280 scores outliers beyond the threshold. 

4281 

4282 Args: 

4283 session_name: name of session being evaluated. 

4284 gain_ratio_rms: tuple containing a list of scan IDs and a list of 

4285 corresponding gain ratio RMS. 

4286 threshold: threshold used to determine whether the gain ratio RMS is 

4287 high enough to return a lowered score. 

4288 

4289 Returns: 

4290 QAScore object 

4291 """ 

4292 # Retrieve the gain ratio RMS and scan IDs. 

4293 scanids, ratio_rms = gain_ratio_rms 

4294 

4295 # Identify outlier gain ratio RMS 

4296 ind_bad = np.where(np.asarray(ratio_rms) > threshold)[0] 

4297 

4298 if len(ind_bad) > 0: 

4299 score = 0.6 

4300 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has gain ratio RMS greater than {threshold} in scan(s)" \ 

4301 f" {utils.commafy([str(s) for s in np.asarray(scanids)[ind_bad]], quotes=False)}." 

4302 shortmsg = "High gain ratio RMS" 

4303 else: 

4304 score = 1.0 

4305 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has gain ratio RMS <= the threshold of {threshold} for all scans." 

4306 shortmsg = "Gain ratio RMS" 

4307 

4308 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_gain_ratio_rms', 

4309 metric_score=score, 

4310 metric_units='gain ratio rms') 

4311 

4312 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)

4314 

4315@log_qa 

4316def score_polcal_leakage(session_name: str, ant_names: dict, leakage_result: PolcalWorkerResults, th_poor: float = 0.10, 

4317 th_bad: float = 0.15) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4318 """ 

4319 This heuristic inspects the polarization calibrator leakage (D-terms) 

4320 solutions caltable and create a score based on how large the deviation from 

4321 zero is. 

4322 

4323 Args: 

4324 session_name: name of session being evaluated. 

4325 ant_names: dictionary mapping antenna IDs to names. 

4326 leakage_result: PolcalWorker task result object containing the 

4327 CalApplication for the leakage caltable to analyze. 

4328 th_poor: threshold used to declare that leakage solutions are poor. 

4329 th_bad: threshold used to declare that leakage solutions are bad. 

4330 Returns: 

4331 List of QAScore objects. 

4332 """ 

4333 scores = [] 

4334 # Score each caltable in result. 

4335 for calapp in leakage_result.final: 

4336 # Retrieve data from leakage solutions caltable. 

4337 with casa_tools.TableReader(calapp.gaintable) as table: 

4338 # Retrieve unique SpWs and antennas. 

4339 uniq_spws = sorted(set(table.getcol('SPECTRAL_WINDOW_ID'))) 

4340 uniq_ants = sorted(set(table.getcol('ANTENNA1'))) 

4341 

4342 # Score each SpW separately. 

4343 for spwid in uniq_spws: 

4344 # Retrieve D-terms for current SpW. 

4345 data = table.query(f"SPECTRAL_WINDOW_ID=={spwid}", columns='CPARAM') 

4346 dterms = data.getcol('CPARAM') 

4347 

4348 # For each antenna, check if the D-terms solutions exceed the 

4349 # threshold. 

4350 bad_antids = [] 

4351 poor_antids = [] 

4352 for antid in uniq_ants: 

4353 pol1 = dterms[0, :, antid] 

4354 pol2 = dterms[1, :, antid] 

4355 

4356 rpol1 = abs(np.real(pol1)) > th_bad 

4357 ipol1 = abs(np.imag(pol1)) > th_bad 

4358 rpol2 = abs(np.real(pol2)) > th_bad 

4359 ipol2 = abs(np.imag(pol2)) > th_bad 

4360 

4361 if rpol1.any() or ipol1.any() or rpol2.any() or ipol2.any(): 

4362 bad_antids.append(antid) 

4363 continue 

4364 

4365 rpol1 = abs(np.real(pol1)) > th_poor 

4366 ipol1 = abs(np.imag(pol1)) > th_poor 

4367 rpol2 = abs(np.real(pol2)) > th_poor 

4368 ipol2 = abs(np.imag(pol2)) > th_poor 

4369 

4370 if rpol1.any() or ipol1.any() or rpol2.any() or ipol2.any(): 

4371 poor_antids.append(antid) 

4372 

4373 if poor_antids: 

4374 score = 0.75 

4375 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has D-terms solutions that deviate by {th_poor}-{th_bad} for" \ 

4376 f" SpW {spwid}, antenna(s)" \ 

4377 f" {utils.commafy([ant_names[i] for i in poor_antids], quotes=False)}." 

4378 shortmsg = "Large deviation D-terms solutions" 

4379 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_leakage', 

4380 metric_score=score, 

4381 metric_units='D-terms solutions deviation') 

4382 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

4383 

4384 if bad_antids: 

4385 score = 0.55 

4386 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has D-terms solutions that deviate by more than {th_bad} for" \ 

4387 f" SpW {spwid}, antenna(s)" \ 

4388 f" {utils.commafy([ant_names[i] for i in bad_antids], quotes=False)}." 

4389 shortmsg = "Very large deviation D-terms solutions" 

4390 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_leakage', 

4391 metric_score=score, 

4392 metric_units='D-terms solutions deviation') 

4393 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

4394 

4395 # If no poor D-terms solutions are found, then create a good score. 

4396 if not scores: 

4397 score = 1.0 

4398 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has D-terms solutions <= the threshold of {th_poor} for all SpWs and" \ 

4399 f" antennas." 

4400 shortmsg = "D-terms solutions" 

4401 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_leakage', 

4402 metric_score=score, 

4403 metric_units='D-terms solutions deviation') 

4404 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

4405 

4406 return scores 

4407 

4408 

4409@log_qa 

4410def score_polcal_residual_pol(session_name: str, pfg_result: dict, threshold: float = 0.001) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4411 """ 

4412 This heuristic inspects the dictionary returned by CASA's polfromgain and 

4413 scores the residual polarization in Q and U, compared to a threshold. 

4414 

4415 Args: 

4416 session_name: name of session being evaluated. 

4417 pfg_result: dictionary of results produced by polfromgain 

4418 threshold: threshold for residual polarization, above which the score 

4419 should be lowered. 

4420 Returns: 

4421 List of QAScore objects. 

4422 """ 

4423 scores = [] 

4424 

4425 # Create score for each field. 

4426 for field_name, field_result in pfg_result.items(): 

4427 # Check residual polarization for each SpW. 

4428 bad_spwids = [] 

4429 for spwid, spw_result in field_result.items(): 

4430 # Skip the result for "Average SpW". 

4431 if 'Ave' in spwid: 

4432 continue 

4433 

4434 # The SpW result is a list of [I, Q, U, V], check whether Q or U 

4435 # exceed threshold. 

4436 if abs(spw_result[1]) > threshold or abs(spw_result[2]) > threshold: 

4437 bad_spwids.append(spwid[3:]) 

4438 

4439 # Create a score depending on whether any SpW had too high residual 

4440 # polarization. 

4441 if bad_spwids: 

4442 score = 0.5 

4443 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' has residual polarization greater than {threshold} in SpW(s)" \ 

4444 f" {utils.commafy(bad_spwids, quotes=False)}." 

4445 shortmsg = "High residual polarization" 

4446 else: 

4447 score = 1.0 

4448 longmsg = f"Session '{session_name}' residual polarization <= the threshold of {threshold}." 

4449 shortmsg = "Residual polarization" 

4450 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_residual_pol', 

4451 metric_score=score, 

4452 metric_units='residual polarization') 

4453 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

4454 

4455 return scores 

4456

4458@log_qa 

4459def score_polcal_results(session_name: str, caltables: list) -> pqa.QAScore: 

4460 """ 

4461 This heuristic tests whether calibrations were derived for a polcal session. 

4462 

4463 Args: 

4464 session_name: name of session being evaluated. 

4465 caltables: list of calibration tables derived for session. 

4466 

4467 Returns: 

4468 QAScore object 

4469 """ 

4470 if not caltables: 

4471 score = 0.0 

4472 longmsg = f"No polarisation calibration derived for session '{session_name}'." 

4473 shortmsg = "No polarisation calibration for session" 

4474 else: 

4475 score = 1.0 

4476 longmsg = f"Polarisation calibration derived for session '{session_name}'." 

4477 shortmsg = "Polarisation calibration derived for session" 

4478 

4479 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_polcal_results', 

4480 metric_score=score, 

4481 metric_units='polarisation caltables') 

4482 

4483 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)

4486@log_qa 

4487def score_fluxservice(result: ALMAImportDataResults) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4488 """ 

4489 Returns QA scores based on: 

4490 1. Flux catalog service usage and flux origin 

4491 2. Age of the nearest monitoring point (if applicable) 

4492 """ 

4493 flux_qa_dict = { 

4494 'FIRSTURL': (1.0, "Flux catalog service used."), 

4495 'BACKUPURL': (0.9, "Backup flux catalog service used."), 

4496 'FAIL': (0.3, "Online flux catalog unavailable. Pipeline halted after weblog creation."), 

4497 None: (1.0, "Flux catalog service not used.") 

4498 } 

4499 

4500 if result.fluxservice not in flux_qa_dict: 

4501 LOG.warning(f"Unrecognized flux catalog service result: {result.fluxservice}. Falling back to default suboptimal qa score of 0.9.") 

4502 

4503 flux_score, flux_msg = flux_qa_dict.get(result.fluxservice, (0.9, "Unknown result from flux catalogue service.")) 

4504 

4505 ampcal = None 

4506 ampcal_spws = [] 

4507 agecounter = 0 

4508 scores = [] 

4509 

4510 if result.fluxservice in ('FIRSTURL', 'BACKUPURL'): 

4511 for setjy_result in result.setjy_results: 

4512 for fieldid, measurements in setjy_result.measurements.items(): 

4513 fieldobjs = result.mses[0].get_fields(field_id=fieldid) 

4514 ampcals = [f for f in fieldobjs if 'AMPLITUDE' in f.intents] 

4515 if not ampcals: 

4516 continue 

4517 

4518 ampcal = ampcals[0] 

4519 

4520 for m in measurements: 

4521 if getattr(m, 'origin', None) == 'Source.xml': 

4522 flux_score = min(flux_score, 0.3) 

4523 ampcal_spws.append(str(m.spw_id)) 

4524 

4525 age = getattr(m, 'age', None) 

4526 if age is None: 

4527 LOG.debug("Skipping measurement due to missing age data.") 

4528 elif abs(int(age)) > 14: 

4529 agecounter += 1 

4530 

4531 if ampcal_spws and ampcal: 

4532 flux_msg = ( 

4533 f"For {result.mses[0].basename}, the origin of the adopted flux for the flux " 

4534 f"calibrator {ampcal.name} is the ASDM for the following spws: {', '.join(ampcal_spws)}." 

4535 ) 

4536 

4537 # Score based on monitor point age 

4538 age_score = 0.5 if agecounter > 0 else 1.0 

4539 age_msg = ( 

4540 f"Age of nearest monitoring point exceeds 14 days for {agecounter} measurement(s)." 

4541 if agecounter > 0 else 

4542 "All monitoring points are within acceptable age range." 

4543 ) 

4544 

4545 scores.append(pqa.QAScore( 

4546 age_score, longmsg=age_msg, shortmsg=age_msg, 

4547 origin=pqa.QAOrigin('flux_monitor_age', age_score, 'days') 

4548 )) 

4549 

4550 # Score for flux catalog usage 

4551 scores.append(pqa.QAScore( 

4552 flux_score, longmsg=flux_msg, shortmsg=flux_msg, 

4553 origin=pqa.QAOrigin('flux_catalog_service', flux_score, 'flux service') 

4554 )) 

4555 

4556 return scores 

4557

4560def score_fluxservicemessages(result): 

4561 """ 

4562 Report any flux service messaging and status codes 

4563 """ 

4564 if result.inputs['dbservice'] is False: 

4565 score = 1.0 

4566 longmsg = "Flux catalog service not used. No warning messages reported." 

4567 shortmsg = longmsg 

4568 elif result.inputs['dbservice'] is True: 

4569 score = 1.0 

4570 longmsg = "No warning messages from the flux catalog service." 

4571 shortmsg = longmsg 

4572 if result.qastatus: 

4573 longmsg = "" 

4574 for qacode in result.qastatus: 

4575 if qacode['clarification']: 

4576 score = 0.5 

4577 # Queries a per source, so there may be more than one message returned. 

4578 longmsg += "Source: {!s}, Status code: {!s}, Message: {!s}\n".format(qacode['source'], 

4579 qacode['status_code'], 

4580 qacode['clarification']) 

4581 shortmsg = "Flux service returned warning messages." 

4582 

4583 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_fluxservice_messaging', 

4584 metric_score=score, 

4585 metric_units='flux service messaging') 

4586 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)

4633@log_qa 

4634def score_mom8_fc_image(mom8_fc_name, mom8_fc_peak_snr, mom8_10_fc_histogram_asymmetry, mom8_fc_max_segment_beams, mom8_fc_frac_max_segment): 

4635 """ 

4636 Check the MOM8 FC image for outliers above a given SNR threshold. The score 

4637 can vary between 0.33 and 1.0 depending on the fraction of outlier pixels. 

4638 """ 

4639 

4640 mom8_fc_outlier_threshold1 = 5.0 

4641 mom8_fc_outlier_threshold2 = 3.5 

4642 mom8_fc_histogram_asymmetry_threshold1 = 0.20 

4643 mom8_fc_histogram_asymmetry_threshold2 = 0.05 

4644 mom8_fc_max_segment_beams_threshold = 1.0 

4645 mom8_fc_score_min = 0.33 

4646 mom8_fc_score_max = 1.00 

4647 mom8_fc_metric_scale = 100.0 

4648 if mom8_fc_frac_max_segment != 0.0: 

4649 mom8_fc_score = mom8_fc_score_min + 0.5 * (mom8_fc_score_max - mom8_fc_score_min) * (1.0 + special.erf(-np.log10(mom8_fc_metric_scale * mom8_fc_frac_max_segment))) 

4650 else: 

4651 mom8_fc_score = mom8_fc_score_max 

4652 

4653 with casa_tools.ImageReader(mom8_fc_name) as image: 

4654 info = image.miscinfo() 

4655 field = info.get('field') 

4656 spw = info.get('virtspw') 

4657 

4658 if (mom8_fc_peak_snr > mom8_fc_outlier_threshold1 and mom8_10_fc_histogram_asymmetry > mom8_fc_histogram_asymmetry_threshold1) or \ 

4659 (mom8_fc_peak_snr > mom8_fc_outlier_threshold2 and mom8_10_fc_histogram_asymmetry > mom8_fc_histogram_asymmetry_threshold2 and mom8_fc_max_segment_beams > mom8_fc_max_segment_beams_threshold): 

4660 mom8_fc_final_score = min(mom8_fc_score, 0.65) 

4661 else: 

4662 mom8_fc_final_score = max(mom8_fc_score, 0.67) 

4663 

4664 if 0.33 <= mom8_fc_final_score < 0.66: 

4665 longmsg = 'MOM8 FC image for field {:s} virtspw {:s} with a peak SNR of {:#.5g} and a flux histogram asymmetry which indicate that there may be residual line emission in the findcont channels.'.format(field, spw, mom8_fc_peak_snr) 

4666 shortmsg = 'MOM8 FC image indicates residual line emission' 

4667 weblog_location = pqa.WebLogLocation.UNSET 

4668 else: 

4669 longmsg = 'MOM8 FC image for field {:s} virtspw {:s} has a peak SNR of {:#.5g} and no significant flux histogram asymmetry.'.format(field, spw, mom8_fc_peak_snr) 

4670 shortmsg = 'MOM8 FC peak SNR and flux histogram' 

4671 weblog_location = pqa.WebLogLocation.ACCORDION 

4672 

4673 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_mom8_fc_image', 

4674 metric_score=(mom8_fc_peak_snr, mom8_10_fc_histogram_asymmetry, mom8_fc_max_segment_beams, mom8_fc_frac_max_segment), 

4675 metric_units='Peak SNR / Histogram asymmetry, Max. segment size in beams, Max. segment fraction') 

4676 

4677 return pqa.QAScore(mom8_fc_final_score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin, weblog_location=weblog_location) 

4678
