4735 

4736def _score_rasterscan_correctness(rasterscan_heuristics_results: dict[str, RasterScanHeuristicsResult], msg: str) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4737 """Generate score of raster scan correctness of importdata or imaging. 

4738 

4739 Args: 

4740 rasterscan_heuristics_results (dict[str, RasterScanHeuristicsResult]): Dictionary of raster heuristics result objects 

4741 treats QAScore of raster scan analysis. 

4742 msg (str): short message for QA 

4743 

4744 Returns: 

4745 list[pqa.QAScore]: lists contains QAScore objects. 

4746 """ 

4747 

4748 qa_scores = [] # [pqa.QAScore] 

4749 

4750 # converting rasterscan_heuristics_results to QA score 

4751 for _execblock_id, _rasterscan_heuristics_results_list in rasterscan_heuristics_results.items(): 

4752 for _results_list in _rasterscan_heuristics_results_list: 

4753 _failed_ants = np.unique(_results_list.get_antennas_rasterscan_failed()) 

4754 if len(_failed_ants) > 0: 

4755 qa_scores.append(_rasterscan_failed_per_eb(_execblock_id, _failed_ants, msg)) 

4756 

4757 return qa_scores 

4758 

4759 

4760def _rasterscan_failed_per_eb(execblock_id:str, failed_ants: list[str], msg: str) -> 'pqa.QAScore': 

4761 """Return an object which has FAILED information in raster scan analysis. 

4762 

4763 Args: 

4764 execblock_id (str): Execute Block ID 

4765 failed_ants (list[str]): List of antenna names 

4766 msg: short message for QA 

4767 

4768 Returns: 

4769 pqa.QAScore: QA score object 

4770 """ 

4771 SCORE_FAIL = 0.8 

4772 longmsg = msg + f' : EB:{execblock_id}:{",".join(failed_ants)}' 

4773 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_rasterscan_correctness', 

4774 metric_score=SCORE_FAIL, 

4775 metric_units='raster scan correctness') 

4776 return pqa.QAScore(SCORE_FAIL, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=msg, origin=origin)

4779@log_qa 

4780def score_tsysflagcontamination_contamination_flagged(vis, summaries) -> pqa.QAScore: 

4781 """ 

4782 Calculate a score for the hifa_tsysflagcontamination task based on whether 

4783 any line contamination was flagged. 

4784 

4785 0% flagged -> 1 

4786 >0% flagged -> 0.9

4794 else:

4797 shortmsg = 'No Tsys line contamination'

4802 return pqa.QAScore(

4804 longmsg=longmsg, 

4805 shortmsg=shortmsg, 

4806 vis=os.path.basename(vis), 

4807 origin=origin, 

4808 applies_to=pqa.TargetDataSelection(vis={vis}) 

4809 )

4812@log_qa 

4813def score_tsysflagcontamination_external_heuristic(foreign_qascores: list[pqa.QAScore]) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4814 """ 

4815 Adopt QA scores that originate from the Tsysflag line contamination 

4816 heuristic. 

4817 

4818 The QA scores are generated in an external heuristic. This metric 

4819 is here mainly to log the QA scores to console for non-weblog runs 

4820 via the @log_qa decorator. 

4821 """ 

4822 origin = pqa.QAOrigin( 

4823 metric_name="score_tsysflagcontamination_external_heuristic", 

4824 metric_score="N/A", 

4825 metric_units="", 

4826 ) 

4827 qascores = [] 

4828 for fq in foreign_qascores: 

4829 adopted_qascore = pqa.QAScore( 

4830 score=fq.score, 

4831 shortmsg=fq.shortmsg, 

4832 longmsg=fq.longmsg, 

4833 applies_to=fq.applies_to, 

4834 origin=origin 

4835 ) 

4836 qascores.append(adopted_qascore) 

4837 return qascores

4839 

4840@log_qa 

4841def score_iersstate(mses: list[MeasurementSet]) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4842 """ 

4843 Check state of IERS tables relative to observation date 

4844 """ 

4845 

4846 iers_info = utils.IERSInfo() 

4847 # reorder MSes by start time 

4848 by_start = sorted(mses, 

4849 key=lambda m: utils.get_epoch_as_datetime(m.start_time)) 

4850 

4851 # create an interval for each one, including our tolerance 

4852 scores = [] 

4853 for ms in by_start: 

4854 longmsg = (f"Dates for {ms.basename} fully covered by IERSeop2000.") 

4855 shortmsg = "MS dates fully covered by IERSeop2000." 

4856 time_end = utils.get_epoch_as_datetime(ms.end_time) 

4857 

4858 if iers_info.validate_date(time_end): 

4859 score = 1.0 

4860 elif iers_info.date_message_type(time_end) == "INFO": 

4861 score = 0.9 

4862 longmsg = (f"Dates for {ms.basename} not fully covered by IERSeop2000. CASA will use IERSpredict.") 

4863 shortmsg = "MS dates not fully covered by IERSeop2000. CASA will use IERSpredict." 

4864 elif iers_info.date_message_type(time_end) == "WARN": 

4865 score = 0.5 

4866 longmsg = (f"Dates for {ms.basename} not fully covered by IERSeop2000. CASA will use IERSpredict.") 

4867 shortmsg = "MS dates not fully covered by IERSeop2000. CASA will use IERSpredict." 

4868 else: 

4869 score = 0.3 

4870 longmsg = (f"Dates for {ms.basename} not fully covered by IERSeop2000. Please update your data repository.") 

4871 shortmsg = "MS dates not fully covered by IERSpredict. Please update your data repository." 

4872 

4873 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_iersstate', 

4874 metric_score=score, 

4875 metric_units='state of IERS tables relative to observation date') 

4876 

4877 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, vis=ms.basename, origin=origin)) 

4878 

4879 return scores 

4880 

4881 

4882@log_qa 

4883def score_amp_vs_time_plots(context: Context, result: SDApplycalResults) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

4884 """Calculate score about calibrated amplitude vs. time plot of Single Dish Applycal. 

4885 

4886 Calculate score according to the existence of plot file for each EB, spw and antenna 

4887 and the quality of it. 

4888 Requirement of PIPE-2168: 

4889 When the plot is created successfully, score = 1. 

4890 When the plot is generated but contains no data of target, score = 0.8. 

4891 When the plot generation failed, score = 0.65. 

4892 To give such score values, check the following: 

4893 1. Check whether the file of plot exists or not. 

4894 2. Check whether the number of flagged data is equal to that of total data or not. 

4895 

4896 Args: 

4897 context: Pipeline context object containing state information. 

4898 result: SDApplycalResults instance. 

4899 

4900 Returns: 

4901 list[pqa.QAScore]: List which contains QAScore objects. 

4902 """ 

4903 vis = os.path.basename(result.inputs['vis']) 

4904 ms = context.observing_run.get_ms(vis) 

4905 spwids = [spw.id for spw in ms.get_spectral_windows()] 

4906 ants = ['all'] + [ant.name for ant in ms.get_antenna()] 

4907 

4908 stage_dir = os.path.join(context.report_dir, 'stage%s' % context.task_counter) 

4909 

4910 flagdata = {} 

4911 flagkwargs = [f"spw='{spwid}' fieldcnt=False antenna='*&&&' intent='OBSERVE_TARGET#ON_SOURCE' mode='summary' name='spw{spwid}'" for spwid in spwids] 

4912 flagdata_task = casa_tasks.flagdata(vis=vis, mode='list', inpfile=flagkwargs, flagbackup=False) 

4913 flagdata = flagdata_task.execute() 

4914 flagdata_summary = list(flagdata.values()) 

4915 scores = [] 

4916 PlotMetadata = collections.namedtuple( 

4917 'PlotMetadata', ['vis', 'spw', 'ant'] 

4918 ) 

4919 all_plots = itertools.chain( 

4920 result.amp_vs_time_summary_plots, 

4921 result.amp_vs_time_detail_plots 

4922 ) 

4923 metadata_for_plots = [ 

4924 PlotMetadata( 

4925 vis=x.parameters["vis"], 

4926 spw=x.parameters["spw"], 

4927 ant=x.parameters["ant"] 

4928 ) for x in all_plots 

4929 ] 

4930 for spwid in spwids: 

4931 shortmsg_success = 'Calibrated amplitude vs time plot is successfully created' 

4932 longmsg_success = f'{shortmsg_success} for EB {vis}, SPW {spwid}' 

4933 shortmsg_failed = 'Failed to create calibrated amplitude vs time plot' 

4934 longmsg_failed = f'{shortmsg_failed} for EB {vis}, SPW {spwid}' 

4935 shortmsg_empty = 'No target data about calibrated amplitude vs time plot' 

4936 longmsg_empty = f'{shortmsg_empty} for EB {vis}, SPW {spwid}' 

4937 sumflagged = 0 

4938 sumtotal = 0 

4939 key = f'spw{spwid}' 

4940 target_summary = [x for x in flagdata_summary if x['name'] == key] 

4941 assert len(target_summary) == 1 

4942 target_summary_for_spw = target_summary[0] 

4943 

4944 for ant in ants: 

4945 # Instead of checking the existence of a plot file, 

4946 # compare metadata for the plot object associated with 

4947 # the plot file. 

4948 plot_metadata = PlotMetadata( 

4949 vis=vis, 

4950 spw=str(spwid), 

4951 ant=ant 

4952 ) 

4953 if plot_metadata not in metadata_for_plots: 

4954 shortmsg = shortmsg_failed 

4955 longmsg = f'{longmsg_failed}, Antenna {ant}.' 

4956 score = 0.65 

4957 else: 

4958 target_for_spw_ant = target_summary_for_spw['antenna'] 

4959 if ant == 'all': 

4960 for value in target_for_spw_ant.values(): 

4961 sumflagged += value['flagged'] 

4962 sumtotal += value['total'] 

4963 all_flagged = sumflagged == sumtotal 

4964 else: 

4965 all_flagged = ant in target_for_spw_ant and target_for_spw_ant[ant]['flagged'] == target_for_spw_ant[ant]['total'] 

4966 if all_flagged: 

4967 shortmsg = shortmsg_empty 

4968 longmsg = f'{longmsg_empty}, Antenna {ant}.' 

4969 score = 0.8 

4970 else: 

4971 shortmsg = shortmsg_success 

4972 longmsg = f'{longmsg_success}, Antenna {ant}.' 

4973 score = 1.0 

4974 

4975 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='AmpVsTimePlotQuality', 

4976 metric_score=score, 

4977 metric_units='Score based on quality of calibrated amp vs time plots') 

4978 applies_to = pqa.TargetDataSelection(vis={vis}, 

4979 spw={spwid}, 

4980 intent={'OBSERVE_TARGET#ON_SOURCE'}, 

4981 ant={ant}) 

4982 scores.append(pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin, applies_to=applies_to)) 

4983 

4984 return scores

4986 

4987def score_parallactic_angle_range( 

4988 mses: list[MeasurementSet], 

4989 intents: set[str], 

4990 threshold: float 

4991 ) -> tuple[list[pqa.QAScore], dict[str, Any]]: 

4992 """ 

4993 Check that the parallactic angle coverage of the intent(s) meets the required threshold. 

4994 

4995 Args: 

4996 mses: a list of MeasurementSet objects 

4997 intents: a set containing all data intent(s) to check for 

4998 threshold: the minimum acceptable value of parallactic angle coverage 

4999 

5000 Returns: 

5001 a tuple containing a list of QA scores and a dictionary with information related to the 

5002 parallactic angle of the intent(s) 

5003 """ 

5004 # holds list of all QA scores for this metric 

5005 all_scores: list[pqa.QAScore] = [] 

5006 # holds all parallactic angle ranges for all 

5007 # session names, intents and calibrator names 

5008 all_metrics = {'sessions': {}, 'intents_found': False} 

5009 

5010 intents_present = any([intents.intersection(ms.intents) for ms in mses]) 

5011 

5012 # group MSes per sessions, adding to default 'Shared' session if not 

5013 # defined 

5014 session_to_mses = collections.defaultdict(list) 

5015 for ms in mses: 

5016 session_to_mses[getattr(ms, 'session', 'Shared')].append(ms) 

5017 

5018 # Check parallactic angle for each calibrator in each session 

5019 for session_name, session_mses in session_to_mses.items(): 

5020 all_metrics['sessions'][session_name] = {'min_parang_range': 360.0, 

5021 'vis': [ms_do.name for ms_do in session_mses]} 

5022 for intent in intents: 

5023 all_metrics['sessions'][session_name][intent] = {} 

5024 cal_names = {cal.name 

5025 for ms in session_mses 

5026 for cal in ms.get_fields(intent=intent)} 

5027 if len(cal_names) > 0: 

5028 all_metrics['intents_found'] = True 

5029 for cal_name in cal_names: 

5030 parallactic_range = ous_parallactic_range(session_mses, cal_name, intent) 

5031 if parallactic_range is not None: 

5032 all_metrics['sessions'][session_name][intent][cal_name] = parallactic_range 

5033 all_metrics['sessions'][session_name]['min_parang_range'] = min( 

5034 all_metrics['sessions'][session_name]['min_parang_range'], parallactic_range) 

5035 LOG.info(f'Parallactic angle range for {cal_name} ({intent}) in session {session_name}: ' 

5036 f'{parallactic_range}') 

5037 session_scores = score_parallactic_range( 

5038 intents_present, session_name, cal_name, parallactic_range, threshold 

5039 ) 

5040 all_scores.extend(session_scores) 

5041 

5042 return all_scores, all_metrics

5044 

5045def score_pointing_outlier( 

5046 ms: MeasurementSet, 

5047 pointing: bool, 

5048 pointing_outlier_stats: dict[tuple[int, int], PointingOutlierStats] 

5049) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

5050 """Generate QA score for pointing outliers. 

5051 

5052 If pointing outliers are detected, the score is set to 0.83. 

5053 In that case, this function creates QAScore objects for each 

5054 combination of field and antenna that have pointing outliers. 

5055 The score is 1.0 if no pointing outliers are detected. 

5056 

5057 Args: 

5058 ms: MS domain object. 

5059 pointing: Whether pointing flag is applied or not. 

5060 pointing_outlier_stats: Dictionary of pointing outlier 

5061 statistics indexed by (field_id, antenna_id). 

5062 

5063 Returns: 

5064 List of QAScore objects. 

5065 """ 

5066 # If no pointing outliers are detected, return QAScore with score of 1.0 

5067 metric_name = "NumberOfPointingOutliers" 

5068 metric_units = "number of pointing outliers" 

5069 if len(pointing_outlier_stats) == 0: 

5070 score = 1.0 

5071 longmsg = f'No pointing outliers detected in "{ms.basename}".' 

5072 shortmsg = "No pointing outliers detected" 

5073 

5074 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name=metric_name, 

5075 metric_score=0, 

5076 metric_units=metric_units) 

5077 applies_to = pqa.TargetDataSelection( 

5078 vis={ms.basename} 

5079 ) 

5080 score = pqa.QAScore( 

5081 score, 

5082 longmsg=longmsg, 

5083 shortmsg=shortmsg, 

5084 vis=ms.basename, 

5085 origin=origin, 

5086 applies_to=applies_to 

5087 ) 

5088 return [score] 

5089 

5090 # score is 0.83 when pointing outlier is detected (PIPEREQ-358/PIPE-2533) 

5091 qa_scores = [] 

5092 for (field_id, antenna_id), stats in pointing_outlier_stats.items(): 

5093 num_outliers = len(stats.outliers) 

5094 field = ms.get_fields(field_id=field_id)[0] 

5095 antenna = ms.get_antenna(str(antenna_id))[0] 

5096 assert num_outliers > 0 

5097 score = 0.83 

5098 max_separation = np.max(stats.separations) 

5099 assert len(stats.timerange) > 0 

5100 time_range_str = ', '.join(stats.timerange) 

5101 longmsg = ( 

5102 f'Pointing outliers detected in "{ms.basename}" , Field "{field.name}", Antenna "{antenna.name}". ' 

5103 f"Flagged time range is {time_range_str}. " 

5104 f"Max separation from nominal field center is {max_separation:.2f} deg." 

5105 ) 

5106 shortmsg = "Pointing outliers detected" 

5107 if not pointing: 

5108 longmsg += " However, poinging flag was not applied." 

5109 shortmsg += " (but not flagged)" 

5110 

5111 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name=metric_name, 

5112 metric_score=num_outliers, 

5113 metric_units=metric_units) 

5114 applies_to = pqa.TargetDataSelection( 

5115 vis={ms.basename}, 

5116 field={field_id}, 

5117 ant={antenna_id} 

5118 ) 

5119 qa_scores.append( 

5120 pqa.QAScore( 

5121 score, 

5122 longmsg=longmsg, 

5123 shortmsg=shortmsg, 

5124 vis=ms.basename, 

5125 origin=origin, 

5126 applies_to=applies_to 

5127 ) 

5128 ) 

5129 

5130 return qa_scores 

5131 

5132@log_qa 

5133def score_syspowerdata(data: dict) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

5134 """Calculates QA score as the minimum of per-band scores based on data points outside 0.7-1.2 range. 

5135 

5136 For each band: 

5137 - Band QA = 1.0 - (fraction of values outside [0.7, 1.2]) 

5138 Final QA = minimum of all band QA scores. 

5139 

5140 Args: 

5141 data (dict[str, list[float]]): Dictionary with band as key and list of float values. 

5142 

5143 Returns: 

5144 pqa.QAScore: QA score object 

5145 """ 

5146 

5147 band_score = None 

5148 qascores = [] 

5149 for band, values in data.items(): 

5150 outliers = [v for v in values.data.flatten() if v < 0.7 or v > 1.2] 

5151 fraction_outside = len(outliers) / len(values.data.flatten()) 

5152 band_score = (1 - fraction_outside) 

5153 

5154 longmsg = f"Band {band} has {fraction_outside*100:.2f}% data outside the range 0.7-1.2" 

5155 

5156 shortmsg = (f"{band}: {fraction_outside*100:.2f}% >[0.7-1.2]") 

5157 

5158 

5159 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_syspowerdata', 

5160 metric_score=band_score, 

5161 metric_units='') 

5162 

5163 qascores.append(pqa.QAScore(band_score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)) 

5164 

5165 return qascores 

5166 

5167@log_qa 

5168def score_solint(short_solint:dict, long_solint:dict) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

5169 """Compute a QA score by comparing short and long solints for each band. 

5170 

5171 If any band has a short solint value greater than the corresponding long solint, 

5172 the function assigns a reduced score and includes the affected bands in the message. 

5173 

5174 Parameters: 

5175 short_solint: Dictionary containing bandname and corresponding short solint value. 

5176 long_solint: Dictionary containing bandname and corresponding long solint value. 

5177 

5178 Returns: 

5179 pqa.QAScore: QA score object 

5180 """ 

5181 bandlist = [] 

5182 for band in short_solint: 

5183 if isinstance(short_solint[band], str) or isinstance(long_solint[band], str): 

5184 # PIPE-2686: short-term workaround for the issue from the initial PIPE-2583 implementation. 

5185 LOG.warning( 

5186 f'Skip scoring solint band {band} due to string solint value: short_solint=%r, long_solint=%r', 

5187 short_solint[band], 

5188 long_solint[band], 

5189 ) 

5190 bandlist.append(band) 

5191 else: 

5192 if short_solint[band] >= long_solint[band]: 

5193 bandlist.append(band) 

5194 

5195 if bandlist: 

5196 score = 0.3 

5197 longmsg = f"band {', '.join(bandlist)} has short solint >= long solint, or short solint is 'inf'." 

5198 shortmsg = "short solint >= long solint or short solint is 'inf'" 

5199 else: 

5200 score = 1 

5201 longmsg = 'short solint < long solint' 

5202 shortmsg = 'short solint < long solint' 

5203 

5204 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_solint', 

5205 metric_score=score, 

5206 metric_units='') 

5207 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin) 

5208 

5209 

5210@log_qa 

5211def score_longsolint(context, result) -> list[pqa.QAScore]: 

5212 bandlist = [] 

5213 calscantime = [] 

5214 long_solint = result.longsolint 

5215 ms = context.observing_run.get_ms(result.inputs['vis']) 

5216 

5217 for scanid in context.evla['msinfo'][ms.name].calibrator_scan_select_string.split(","): 

5218 calscantime = [calscan.time_on_source for calscan in ms.get_scans(int(scanid))] 

5219 median_calscantime = np.median(calscantime) 

5220 

5221 for band in long_solint: 

5222 if long_solint[band] > 1.5 * median_calscantime.total_seconds(): 

5223 bandlist.append(band) 

5224 

5225 if bandlist: 

5226 score = 0.3 

5227 longmsg = f"band {', '.join(bandlist)} has long solint > 1.5 * median calibration scan time" 

5228 shortmsg = "long solint > 1.5 * median calibration scan time" 

5229 else: 

5230 score = 1 

5231 longmsg = "long solint < 1.5 * median calibration scan time" 

5232 shortmsg = "long solint < 1.5 * median calibration scan time" 

5233 

5234 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_longsolint', 

5235 metric_score=score, 

5236 metric_units='') 

5237 return pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin)

5239@log_qa 

5240def score_testBPdcals_dts_ants(vis:str, amp_collection:dict, phase_collection:dict, bandname:str) -> pqa.QAScore: 

5241 """Evaluate QA score based on the number of antennas affected by DTS issues.""" 

5242 

5243 bad_ants = [] 

5244 bad_ants.extend([str(a) for a in amp_collection.keys()]) 

5245 bad_ants.extend([str(p) for p in phase_collection.keys()]) 

5246 num_bad_ants = len(set(bad_ants)) 

5247 applies_to = pqa.TargetDataSelection(vis=vis) 

5248 

5249 # PIPE-2580: if > 4 antennas have DTS issue, QA score < 0.5 

5250 if num_bad_ants > 4: 

5251 score = rendererutils.SCORE_THRESHOLD_ERROR 

5252 longmsg = f"{num_bad_ants} antennas have DTS issue in {bandname} band" 

5253 shortmsg = f"{num_bad_ants} antennas have DTS issue in {bandname} band" 

5254 else: 

5255 score = 1.0 

5256 longmsg = f"Fewer than four antennas have DTS issue in {bandname} band" 

5257 shortmsg = f"Fewer than four antennas have DTS issue in {bandname} band" 

5258 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_testBPdcals_dts_ants', 

5259 metric_score=score, 

5260 metric_units='') 

5261 qa_score = pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin, applies_to=applies_to) 

5262 

5263 return qa_score

5286@log_qa 

5287def score_testBPdcals_delay(vis:str, caltable:str, bandname:str) -> pqa.QAScore: 

5288 """Evaluate QA score based on median delay per baseband.""" 

5289 

5290 applies_to = pqa.TargetDataSelection(vis=vis) 

5291 # PIPE-2580: if median delay per baseband > 15 ms, QA score < 0.5 

5292 with casa_tools.TableReader(caltable) as tb: 

5293 fpar = tb.getcol('FPARAM') 

5294 delays = np.abs(fpar) 

5295 median_delay = np.median(delays) 

5296 qa = casa_tools.quanta 

5297 median_delay_val = qa.convert(qa.quantity(median_delay, "ns"), "ms")["value"] 

5298 

5299 if median_delay_val > 15: 

5300 score = rendererutils.SCORE_THRESHOLD_ERROR 

5301 longmsg = f"Median delay > 15 ms for {bandname} band" 

5302 shortmsg = f"Median delay > 15 ms for {bandname} band" 

5303 else: 

5304 score = 1.0 

5305 longmsg = f"Median delay < 15 ms for {bandname} band" 

5306 shortmsg = f"Median delay < 15 ms for {bandname} band" 

5307 

5308 origin = pqa.QAOrigin(metric_name='score_testBPdcals_delay', 

5309 metric_score=score, 

5310 metric_units='') 

5311 qa_score = pqa.QAScore(score, longmsg=longmsg, shortmsg=shortmsg, origin=origin, applies_to=applies_to) 

5312 

5313 return qa_score
